1.verse: Blessed is the man who hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the chair of pestilence.

2.verse: But his will is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he shall meditate day and night.

3.verse: And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters, which shall bring forth its fruit, in due season. And his leaf shall not fall off: and all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper.

4.verse: Not so the wicked, not so: but like the dust, which the wind driveth from the face of the earth.

5.verse: Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment: nor sinners in the council of the just.

6.verse: For the Lord knoweth the way of the just: and the way of the wicked shall perish.

1.verse: Why have the Gentiles raged, and the people devised vain things?

2.verse: The kings of the earth stood up, and the princes met together, against the Lord and against his Christ.

3.verse: Let us break their bonds asunder: and let us cast away their yoke from us.

4.verse: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them: and the Lord shall deride them.

5.verse: Then shall he speak to them in his anger, and trouble them in his rage.

6.verse: But I am appointed king by him over Sion his holy mountain, preaching his commandment.

7.verse: The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee.

8.verse: Ask of me, and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance, and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

9.verse: Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

10.verse: And now, O ye kings, understand: receive instruction, you that judge the earth.

11.verse: Serve ye the Lord with fear: and rejoice unto him with trembling.

12.verse: Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord be angry, and you perish from the just way.

1.verse: The psalm of David when he fled from the face of his son Absalom.

2.verse: Why, O Lord, are they multiplied that afflict me? many are they who rise up against me.

3.verse: Many say to my soul: There is no salvation for him in his God.

4.verse: But thou, O Lord art my protector, my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

5.verse: I have cried to the Lord with my voice: and he hath heard me from his holy hill.

6.verse: I have slept and taken my rest: and I have risen up, because the Lord hath protected me.

7.verse: I will not fear thousands of the people, surrounding me: arise, O Lord; save me, O my God.

8.verse: For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause: thou hast broken the teeth of sinners.

1.verse: Unto the end, in verses. A psalm for David.

2.verse: When I called upon him, the God of my justice heard me: when I was in distress, thou hast enlarged me. Have mercy on me: and hear my prayer.

3.verse: O ye sons of men, how long will you be dull of heart? why do you love vanity, and seek after lying?

4.verse: Know ye also that the Lord hath made his holy one wonderful: the Lord will hear me when I shall cry unto him.

5.verse: Be angry, and sin not: the things you say in your hearts, be sorry for them upon your beds.

6.verse: Offer up the sacrifice of justice, and trust in the Lord: many say, Who sheweth us good things?

7.verse: The light of thy countenance O Lord, is signed upon us: thou hast given gladness in my heart.

8.verse: By the fruit of their corn, their wine and oil, they are multiplied.

1.verse: Unto the end, for her that obtaineth the inheritance. A psalm of David.

2.verse: Give ear, O Lord, to my words, understand my cry.

3.verse: Hearken to the voice of my prayer, O my King and my God.

4.verse: For to thee will I pray: O Lord, in the morning thou shalt hear my voice.

5.verse: In the morning I will stand before thee, and will see: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity.

6.verse: Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee: nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes.

7.verse: Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity: Thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor.

8.verse: But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy, I will come into thy house; I will worship towards thy holy temple, in thy fear.

9.verse: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy justice: because of my enemies, direct my way in thy sight.

10.verse: For there is no truth in their mouth; their heart is vain.

11.verse: Their throat is an open sepulchre: they dealt deceitfully with their tongues: judge them, O God. Let them fall from their devices: according to the multitude of their wickedness cast them out: for they have provoked thee, O Lord.

12.verse: But let all them be glad that hope in thee: they shall rejoice for ever, and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee:

1.verse: Unto the end, in verses, a psalm for David, for the octave.

2.verse: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy indignation, nor chastise me in thy wrath.

3.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am weak: heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled.

4.verse: And my soul is troubled exceedingly: but thou, O Lord, how long?

5.verse: Turn to me, O Lord, and deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercy's sake.

6.verse: For there is no one in death, that is mindful of thee: and who shall confess to thee in hell?

7.verse: I have laboured in my groanings, every night I will wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears.

8.verse: My eye is troubled through indignation: I have grown old amongst all my enemies.

9.verse: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

10.verse: The Lord hath heard my supplication: the Lord hath received my prayer.

1.verse: The psalm of David which he sung to the Lord for the words of Chusi the son of Jemini. [2 Kings 16.]

2.verse: O Lord my God, in thee have I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me.

3.verse: Lest at any time he seize upon my soul like a lion, while there is no one to redeem me, nor to save.

4.verse: O Lord my God, if I have done this thing, if there be iniquity in my hands:

5.verse: If I have rendered to them that repaid me evils, let me deservedly fall empty before my enemies.

6.verse: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and take it, and tread down my life on the earth, and bring down my glory to the dust.

7.verse: Rise up, O Lord, in thy anger: and be thou exalted in the borders of my enemies. And arise, O Lord my God, in the precept which thou hast commanded:

8.verse: And a congregation of people shall surround thee. And for their sakes return thou on high.

9.verse: The Lord judgeth the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice, and according to my innocence in me.

10.verse: The wickedness of sinners shall be brought to nought: and thou shalt direct the just: the searcher of hearts and reins is God.

11.verse: Just is my help from the Lord: who saveth the upright of heart.

12.verse: God is a just judge, strong and patient: is he angry every day?

13.verse: Except you will be converted, he will brandish his sword: he hath bent his bow and made it ready.

14.verse: And in it he hath prepared the instruments of death, he hath made ready his arrows for them that burn.

15.verse: Behold he hath been in labour with injustice; he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth iniquity.

16.verse: He hath opened a pit and dug it; and he is fallen into the hole he made.

17.verse: His sorrow shall be turned on his own head: and his iniquity shall comedown upon his crown.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the presses: a psalm of David.

2.verse: O Lord our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! For thy magnificence is elevated above the heavens.

3.verse: Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise, because of thy enemies, that thou mayst destroy the enemy and the avenger.

4.verse: For I will behold thy heavens, the works of thy fingers: the moon and the stars which thou hast founded.

5.verse: What is man that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man that thou visitest him?

6.verse: Thou hast made him a little less than the angels, thou hast crowned him with glory and honour:

7.verse: And hast set him over the works of thy hands.

8.verse: Thou hast subjected all things under his feet, all sheep and oxen: moreover the beasts also of the fields.

9.verse: The birds of the air, and the fishes of the sea, that pass through the paths of the sea.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the hidden things of the Son. A psalm for David.

2.verse: I will give praise to thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: I will relate all thy wonders.

3.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing to thy name, O thou most high.

4.verse: When my enemy shall be turned back: they shall be weakened and perish before thy face.

5.verse: For thou hast maintained my judgment and my cause: thou hast sat on the throne, who judgest justice.

6.verse: Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles, and the wicked one hath perished: thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.

7.verse: The swords of the enemy have failed unto the end: and their cities thou hast destroyed. Their memory hath perished with a noise.

8.verse: But the Lord remaineth for ever. He hath prepared his throne in judgment:

9.verse: And he shall judge the world in equity, he shall judge the people in justice.

10.verse: And the Lord is become a refuge for the poor: a helper in due time in tribulation.

11.verse: And let them trust in thee who know thy name: for thou hast not forsaken them that seek thee, O Lord.

12.verse: Sing ye to the Lord, who dwelleth in Sion: declare his ways among the Gentiles:

13.verse: For requiring their blood he hath remembered the: he hath not forgotten the cry of the poor.

14.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord: see my humiliation which I suffer from my enemies.

15.verse: Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death, that I may declare all thy praises in the gates of the daughter of Sion.

16.verse: I will rejoice in thy salvation: the Gentiles have stuck fast in the destruction which they have prepared. Their foot hath been taken in the very snare which they hid.

17.verse: The Lord shall be known when he executeth judgments: the sinner hath been caught in the works of his own hands.

18.verse: The wicked shall be turned into hell, all the nations that forget God.

19.verse: For the poor man shall not be forgotten to the end: the patience of the poor shall not perish for ever.

20.verse: Arise, O Lord, let not man be strengthened: let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight.

1.verse: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

2.verse: In the Lord I put my trust: how then do you say to my soul: Get thee away from hence to the mountain like a sparrow?

3.verse: For, lo, the wicked have bent their bow; they have prepared their arrows in the quiver; to shoot in the dark the upright of heart.

4.verse: For they have destroyed the things which thou hast made: but what has the just man done?

5.verse: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord's throne is in heaven. His eyes look on the poor man: his eyelids examine the sons of men.

6.verse: The Lord trieth the just and the wicked: but he that loveth iniquity hateth his own soul.

7.verse: He shall rain snares upon sinners: fire and brimstone and storms of winds shall be the portion of their cup.

8.verse: For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice: his countenance hath beheld righteousness.

1.verse: Unto the end; for the octave, a psalm for David.

2.verse: Save me, O Lord, for there is now no saint: truths are decayed from among the children of men.

3.verse: They have spoken vain things every one to his neighbour: with deceitful lips, and with a double heart have they spoken.

4.verse: May the Lord destroy all deceitful lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things.

5.verse: Who have said: We will magnify our tongue; our lips are our own; who is Lord over us?

6.verse: By reason of the misery of the needy, and the groans of the poor, now will I arise, saith the Lord. I win set him in safety; I will deal confidently in his regard.

7.verse: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried by the fire, purged from the earth refined seven times.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David. How long, O Lord, wilt thou forget me unto the end? how long dost thou turn away thy face from me?

2.verse: How long shall I take counsels in my soul, sorrow in my heart all the day?

3.verse: How long shall my enemy be exalted over me?

4.verse: Consider, and hear me, O Lord my God. Enlighten my eyes that I never sleep in death:

5.verse: Lest at any time my enemy say: I have prevailed against him. They that trouble me will rejoice when I am moved:

6.verse: But I have trusted in thy mercy. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation: I will sing to the Lord, who giveth me good things: yea I will sing to the name of the Lord the most high.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David. The fool hath said in his heart: There is no God, They are corrupt, and are become abominable in their ways: there is none that doth good, no not one.

2.verse: The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there be any that understand and seek God.

3.verse: They are all gone aside, they are become unprofitable together: there is none that doth good, no not one. Their throat is an open sepulchre: with their tongues they acted deceitfully; the poison of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and unhappiness in their ways: and the way of peace they have not known: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

4.verse: Shall not all they know that work iniquity, who devour my people as they eat bread?

5.verse: They have not called upon the Lord: there have they trembled for fear, where there was no fear.

6.verse: For the Lord is in the just generation: you have confounded the counsel of the poor man, but the Lord is his hope.

1.verse: A psalm of David. Lord, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? or who shall rest in thy holy hill?

2.verse: He that walketh without blemish, and worketh justice:

3.verse: He that speaketh truth in his heart, who hath not used deceit in his tongue: Nor hath done evil to his neighbour: nor taken up a reproach against his neighbours.

4.verse: In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour, and deceiveth not;

5.verse: He that hath not put out his money to usury, nor taken bribes against the innocent: He that doth these things shall not be moved for ever.

1.verse: The inscription of a title to David himself. Preserve me, O Lord, for I have put trust in thee.

2.verse: I have said to the Lord, thou art my God, for thou hast no need of my goods.

3.verse: To the saints, who are in his land, he hath made wonderful all my desires in them.

4.verse: Their infirmities were multiplied: afterwards they made haste. I will not gather together their meetings for blood offerings: nor will I be mindful of their names by my lips.

5.verse: The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: it is thou that wilt restore my inheritance to me.

1.verse: The prayer of David. Hear, O Lord, my justice: attend to my supplication. Give ear unto my prayer, which proceedeth not from deceitful lips.

2.verse: Let my judgment come forth from thy countenance: let thy eyes behold the things that are equitable.

3.verse: Thou hast proved my heart, and visited it by night, thou hast tried me by fire: and iniquity hath not been found in me.

4.verse: That my mouth may not speak the works of men: for the sake of the words of thy lips, I have kept hard ways.

5.verse: Perfect thou my goings in thy paths: that my footsteps be not moved.

6.verse: I have cried to thee, for thou, O God, hast heard me: O incline thy ear unto me, and hear my words.

7.verse: shew forth thy wonderful mercies; thou who savest them that trust in thee.

8.verse: From them that resist thy right hand keep me, as the apple of thy eye. Protect me under the shadow of thy wings.

9.verse: From the face of the wicked who have afflicted me. My enemies have surrounded my soul:

10.verse: They have shut up their fat: their mouth hath spoken proudly.

11.verse: They have cast me forth and now they have surrounded me: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth.

1.verse: Unto the end, for David the servant of the Lord, who spoke to the Lord the words of this canticle, in the day that the Lord delivered him from the hands of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul. [2 Kings 22.]

2.verse: I will love thee, O Lord, my strength:

3.verse: The Lord is my firmament, my refuge, and my deliverer. My God is my helper, and in him will I put my trust. My protector and the horn of my salvation, and my support.

4.verse: Praising I will call upon the Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies.

5.verse: The sorrows of death surrounded me: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me.

6.verse: The sorrows of hell encompassed me: and the snares of death prevented me.

7.verse: In my affliction I called upon the Lord, and I cried to my God: And he heard my voice from his holy temple: and my cry before him came into his ears.

8.verse: The earth shook and trembled: the foundations of the mountains were troubled and were moved, because he was angry with them.

9.verse: There went up a smoke in his wrath: and a fire flamed from his face: coals were kindled by it.

10.verse: He bowed the heavens, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.

11.verse: And he ascended upon the cherubim, and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds.

12.verse: And he made darkness his covert, his pavilion round about him: dark waters in the clouds of the air.

13.verse: At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed, hail and coals of fire.

14.verse: And the Lord thundered from heaven, and the highest gave his voice: hail and coals of fire.

15.verse: And he sent forth his arrows, and he scattered them: he multiplied lightnings, and troubled them.

1.verse: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

2.verse: The heavens shew forth the glory of God, and the firmament declareth the work of his hands.

3.verse: Day to day uttereth speech, and night to night sheweth knowledge.

4.verse: There are no speeches nor languages, where their voices are not heard.

5.verse: Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth: and their words unto the ends of the world.

6.verse: He hath set his tabernacle in the sun: and he, as a bridegroom coming out of his bride chamber, Hath rejoiced as a giant to run the way:

7.verse: His going out is from the end of heaven, And his circuit even to the end thereof: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat.

8.verse: The law of the Lord is unspotted, converting souls: the testimony of the Lord is faithful, giving wisdom to little ones.

9.verse: The justices of the Lord are right, rejoicing hearts: the commandment of the Lord is lightsome, enlightening the eyes.

10.verse: The fear of the Lord is holy, enduring for ever and ever: the judgments of the Lord are true, justified in themselves.

11.verse: More to be desired than gold and many precious stones: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.

12.verse: For thy servant keepeth them, and in keeping them there is a great reward.

13.verse: Who can understand sins? from my secret ones cleanse me, O Lord:

14.verse: And from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me, then shall I be without spot: and I shall be cleansed from the greatest sin.

15.verse: And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord, my helper, and my redeemer.

1.verse: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

2.verse: May the Lord hear thee in the day of tribulation: may the name of the God of Jacob protect thee.

3.verse: May he send thee help from the sanctuary: and defend thee out of Sion.

4.verse: May he be mindful of all thy sacrifices: and may thy whole burnt offering be made fat.

5.verse: May he give thee according to thy own heart; and confirm all thy counsels.

6.verse: We will rejoice in thy salvation; and in the name of our God we shall be exalted.

7.verse: The Lord fulfill all thy petitions: now have I known that the Lord hath saved his anointed. He will hear him from his holy heaven: the salvation of his right hand is in powers.

8.verse: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will call upon the name of the Lord our God.

9.verse: They are bound, and have fallen; but we are risen, and are set upright. O Lord, save the king: and hear us in the day that we shall call upon thee.

1.verse: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

2.verse: In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy; and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly.

3.verse: Thou hast given him his heart's desire: and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips.

4.verse: For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones.

5.verse: He asked life of thee: and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever.

6.verse: His glory is great in thy salvation: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him.

7.verse: For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.

8.verse: For the king hopeth in the Lord: and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

9.verse: Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the morning protection, a psalm for David.

2.verse: O God my God, look upon me: why hast thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins.

3.verse: O my God, I shall cry by day, and thou wilt not hear: and by night, and it shall not be reputed as folly in me.

4.verse: But thou dwellest in the holy place, the praise of Israel.

5.verse: In thee have our fathers hoped: they have hoped, and thou hast delivered them.

6.verse: They cried to thee, and they were saved: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

7.verse: But I am a worm, and no man: the reproach of men, and the outcast of the people.

8.verse: All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn: they have spoken with the lips, and wagged the head.

9.verse: He hoped in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he delighteth in him.

10.verse: For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb: my hope from the breasts of my mother.

11.verse: I was cast upon thee from the womb. From my mother's womb thou art my God,

12.verse: Depart not from me. For tribulation is very near: for there is none to help me.

13.verse: Many calves have surrounded me: fat bulls have besieged me.

1.verse: A psalm for David. The Lord ruleth me: and I shall want nothing.

2.verse: He hath set me in a place of pasture. He hath brought me up, on the water of refreshment:

3.verse: He hath converted my soul. He hath led me on the paths of justice, for his own name's sake.

4.verse: For though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death, I will fear no evils, for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they have comforted me.

5.verse: Thou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil; and my chalice which inebriateth me, how goodly is it!

6.verse: And thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life. And that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days.

1.verse: On the first day of the week, a psalm for David. The earth is the Lord's and the fulness thereof: the world, and all they that dwell therein.

2.verse: For he hath founded it upon the seas; and hath prepared it upon the rivers.

3.verse: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord: or who shall stand in his holy place?

4.verse: The innocent in hands, and clean of heart, who hath not taken his soul in vain, nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbour.

5.verse: He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and mercy from God his Saviour.

6.verse: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek the face of the God of Jacob.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David. To thee, O Lord, have I lifted up my soul.

2.verse: In thee, O my God, I put my trust; let me not be ashamed.

3.verse: Neither let my enemies laugh at me: for none of them that wait on thee shall be confounded.

4.verse: Let all them be confounded that act unjust things without cause. shew, O Lord, thy ways to me, and teach me thy paths.

5.verse: Direct me in thy truth, and teach me; for thou art God my Saviour; and on thee have I waited all the day long.

6.verse: Remember, O Lord, thy bowels of compassion; and thy mercies that are from the beginning of the world.

7.verse: The sins of my youth and my ignorances do not remember. According to thy mercy remember thou me: for thy goodness' sake, O Lord.

8.verse: The Lord is sweet and righteous: therefore he will give a law to sinners in the way.

9.verse: He will guide the mild in judgment: he will teach the meek his ways.

10.verse: All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth, to them that seek after his covenant and his testimonies.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David. Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in my innocence: and I have put my trust in the Lord, and shall not be weakened.

2.verse: Prove me, O Lord, and try me; burn my reins and my heart.

3.verse: For thy mercy is before my eyes; and I am well pleased with thy truth.

4.verse: I have not sat with the council of vanity: neither will I go in with the doers of unjust things.

5.verse: I have hated the assembly of the malignant; and with the wicked I will not sit.

6.verse: I will wash my hands among the innocent; and will compass thy altar, O Lord:

7.verse: That I may hear the voice of thy praise: and tell of all thy wondrous works.

8.verse: I have loved, O Lord, the beauty of thy house; and the place where thy glory dwelleth.

9.verse: Take not away my soul, O God, with the wicked: nor my life with bloody men:

10.verse: In whose hands are iniquities: their right hand is filled with gifts.

11.verse: But as for me, I have walked in my innocence: redeem me, and have mercy on me.

12.verse: My foot hath stood in the direct way: in the churches I will bless thee, O Lord.

1.verse: The psalm of David before he was anointed. The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my life: of whom shall I be afraid?

2.verse: Whilst the wicked draw near against me, to eat my flesh. My enemies that trouble me, have themselves been weakened, and have fallen.

3.verse: If armies in camp should stand together against me, my heart shall not fear. If a battle should rise up against me, in this will I be confident.

4.verse: One thing I have asked of the Lord, this will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life. That I may see the delight of the Lord, and may visit his temple.

5.verse: For he hath hidden me in his tabernacle; in the day of evils, he hath protected me in the secret place of his tabernacle.

6.verse: He hath exalted me upon a rock: and now he hath lifted up my head above my enemies. I have gone round, and have offered up in his tabernacle a sacrifice of jubilation: I will sing, and recite a psalm to the Lord.

7.verse: Hear, O Lord, my voice, with which I have cried to thee: have mercy on me and hear me.

8.verse: My heart hath said to thee: My face hath sought thee: thy face, O Lord, will I still seek.

9.verse: Turn not away thy face from me; decline not in thy wrath from thy servant. Be thou my helper, forsake me not; do not thou despise me, O God my Saviour.

10.verse: For my father and my mother have left me: but the Lord hath taken me up.

11.verse: Set me, O Lord, a law in thy way, and guide me in the right path, because of my enemies.

12.verse: Deliver me not over to the will of them that trouble me; for unjust witnesses have risen up against me; and iniquity hath lied to itself.

1.verse: A psalm for David himself. Unto thee will I cry, O Lord: O my God, be not thou silent to me: lest thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

2.verse: Hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication, when I pray to thee; when I lift up my hands to thy holy temple.

3.verse: Draw me not away together with the wicked; and with the workers of iniquity destroy me not: Who speak peace with their neighbour, but evils are in their hearts.

4.verse: Give them according to their works, and according to the wickedness of their inventions. According to the works of their hands give thou to them: render to them their reward.

5.verse: Because they have not understood the works of the Lord, and the operations of his hands: thou shalt destroy them, and shalt not build them up.

6.verse: Blessed be the Lord, for he hath heard the voice of my supplication.

7.verse: The Lord is my helper and my protector: in him hath my heart confided, and I have been helped. And my flesh hath flourished again, and with my will I will give praise to him.

8.verse: The Lord is the strength of his people, and the protector of the salvation of his anointed.

9.verse: Save, O Lord, thy people, and bless thy inheritance: and rule them and exalt them for ever.

1.verse: A psalm for David, at the finishing of the tabernacle. Bring to the Lord, O ye children of God: bring to the Lord the offspring of rams.

2.verse: Bring to the Lord glory and honour: bring to the Lord glory to his name: adore ye the Lord in his holy court.

3.verse: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of majesty hath thundered, The Lord is upon many waters.

4.verse: The voice of the Lord is in power; the voice of the Lord in magnificence.

5.verse: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars: yea, the Lord shall break the cedars of Libanus.

6.verse: And shall reduce them to pieces, as a calf of Libanus, and as the beloved son of unicorns.

7.verse: The voice of the Lord divideth the flame of fire:

8.verse: The voice of the Lord shaketh the desert: and the Lord shall shake the desert of Cades.

9.verse: The voice of the Lord prepareth the stags: and he will discover the thick woods: and in his temple all shall speak his glory.

1.verse: A psalm of a canticle, at the dedication of David's house.

2.verse: I will extol thee, O Lord, for thou hast upheld me: and hast not made my enemies to rejoice over me.

3.verse: O Lord my God, I have cried to thee, and then hast healed me.

4.verse: Thou hast brought forth, O Lord, my soul from hell: thou hast saved me from them that go down into the pit.

5.verse: Sing to the Lord, O ye his saints: and give praise to the memory of his holiness.

6.verse: For wrath is in his indignation; and life in his good will. In the evening weeping shall have place, and in the morning gladness.

7.verse: And in my abundance I said: I shall never be moved.

8.verse: O Lord, in thy favour, thou gavest strength to my beauty. Thou turnedst away thy face from me, and I became troubled.

9.verse: To thee, O Lord, will I cry: and I will make supplication to my God.

10.verse: What profit is there in my blood, whilst I go down to corruption? Shall dust confess to thee, or declare thy truth?

11.verse: The Lord hath heard, and hath had mercy on me: the Lord became my helper.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David, in an ecstasy.

2.verse: In thee, O Lord, have I hoped, let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy justice.

3.verse: Bow down thy ear to me: make haste to deliver me. Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a house of refuge, to save me.

4.verse: For thou art my strength and my refuge; and for thy name's sake thou wilt lead me, and nourish me.

5.verse: Thou wilt bring me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me: for thou art my protector.

6.verse: Into thy hands I commend my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth.

7.verse: Thou hast hated them that regard vanities, to no purpose. But I have hoped in the Lord:

8.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy. For thou hast regarded my humility, thou hast saved my soul out of distresses.

9.verse: And thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a spacious place.

10.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am afflicted: my eye is troubled with wrath, my soul, and my belly:

11.verse: For my life is wasted with grief: and my years in sighs. My strength is weakened through poverty and my bones are disturbed.

12.verse: I am become a reproach among all my enemies, and very much to my neighbours; and a fear to my acquaintance. They that saw me without fled from me.

1.verse: To David himself, understanding. Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

2.verse: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord hath not imputed sin, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

3.verse: Because I was silent my bones grew old; whilst I cried out all the day long.

4.verse: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: I am turned in my anguish, whilst the thorn is fastened.

5.verse: I have acknowledged my sin to thee, and my injustice I have not concealed. I said I will confess against myself my injustice to the Lord: and thou hast forgiven the wickedness of my sin.

6.verse: For this shall every one that is holy pray to thee in a seasonable time. And yet in a flood of many waters, they shall not come nigh unto him.

7.verse: Thou art my refuge from the trouble which hath encompassed me: my joy, deliver me from them that surround me.

8.verse: I will give thee understanding, and I will instruct thee in this way, in which thou shalt go: I will fix my eyes upon thee.

9.verse: Do not become like the horse and the mule, who have no understanding. With bit and bridle bind fast their jaws, who come not near unto thee.

10.verse: Many are the scourges of the sinner, but mercy shall encompass him that hopeth in the Lord.

11.verse: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye just, and glory, all ye right of heart.

1.verse: A psalm for David. Rejoice in the Lord, O ye just: praise becometh the upright.

2.verse: Give praise to the Lord on the harp; sing to him with the psaltery, the instrument of ten strings.

3.verse: Sing to him a new canticle, sing well unto him with a loud noise.

4.verse: For the word of the Lord is right, and all his works are done with faithfulness.

5.verse: He loveth mercy and judgment; the earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.

6.verse: By the word of the Lord the heavens were established; and all the power of them by the spirit of his mouth:

7.verse: Gathering together the waters of the sea, as in a vessel; laying up the depths in storehouses.

8.verse: Let all the earth fear the Lord, and let all the inhabitants of the world be in awe of him.

9.verse: For he spoke and they were made: he commanded and they were created.

10.verse: The Lord bringeth to naught the counsels of nations; and he rejecteth the devices of people, and casteth away the counsels of princes.

11.verse: But the counsel of the Lord standeth for ever: the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

1.verse: For David, when he changed his countenance before Achimelech, who dismissed him, and he went his way. [1 Kings 21.]

2.verse: I will bless the Lord at all times, his praise shall be always in my mouth.

3.verse: In the Lord shall my soul be praised: let the meek hear and rejoice.

4.verse: O magnify the Lord with me; and let us extol his name together.

5.verse: I sought the Lord, and he heard me; and he delivered me from all my troubles.

6.verse: Come ye to him and be enlightened: and your faces shall not be confounded.

7.verse: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him: and saved him out of all his troubles.

8.verse: The angel of the Lord shall encamp round about them that fear him: and shall deliver them.

9.verse: O taste, and see that the Lord is sweet: blessed is the man that hopeth in him.

10.verse: Fear the Lord, all ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.

11.verse: The rich have wanted, and have suffered hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not be deprived of any good.

12.verse: Come, children, hearken to me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

13.verse: Who is the man that desireth life: who loveth to see good days?

14.verse: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

15.verse: Turn away from evil and do good: seek after peace and pursue it.

16.verse: The eyes of the Lord are upon the just: and his ears unto their prayers.

17.verse: But the countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil things: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

18.verse: The just cried, and the Lord heard them: and delivered them out of all their troubles.

19.verse: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart: and he will save the humble of spirit.

20.verse: Many are the afflictions of the just; but out of them all will the Lord deliver them.

21.verse: The Lord keepeth all their bones, not one of them shall be broken.

22.verse: The death of the wicked is very evil: and they that hate the just shall be guilty.

1.verse: For David himself. Judge thou, O Lord, them that wrong me: overthrow them that fight against me.

2.verse: Take hold of arms and shield: and rise up to help me.

3.verse: Bring out the sword, and shut up the way against them that persecute me: say to my soul: I am thy salvation.

4.verse: Let them be confounded and ashamed that seek after my soul. Let them be turned back and be confounded that devise against me.

5.verse: Let them become as dust before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord straiten them.

6.verse: Let their way become dark and slippery; and let the angel of the Lord pursue them.

7.verse: For without cause they have hidden their net for me unto destruction: without cause they have upbraided my soul.

8.verse: Let the snare which he knoweth not come upon him: and let the net which he hath hidden catch him: and let the net which he hath hidden catch him: and into that very snare let them fall.

9.verse: But my soul shall rejoice in the Lord; and shall be delighted in his salvation.

10.verse: All my bones shall say: Lord, who is like to thee? Who deliverest the poor from the hand of them that are stronger than he; the needy and the poor from them that strip him.

11.verse: Unjust witnesses rising up have asked me things I knew not.

12.verse: They repaid me evil for good: to the depriving me of my soul.

13.verse: But as for me, when they were troublesome to me, I was clothed with haircloth. I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer shall be turned into my bosom.

14.verse: As a neighbour and as an own brother, so did I please: as one mourning and sorrowful so was I humbled.

15.verse: But they rejoiced against me, and came together: scourges were gathered together upon me, and I knew not.

16.verse: They were separated, and repented not: they tempted me, they scoffed at me with scorn: they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

17.verse: Lord, when wilt thou look upon me? rescue thou soul from their malice: my only one from the lions.

18.verse: I will give thanks to thee in a great church; I will praise thee in a strong people.

19.verse: Let not them that are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: who have hated me without cause, and wink with the eyes.

20.verse: For they spoke indeed peaceably to me; and speaking in the anger of the earth they devised guile.

21.verse: And they opened their mouth wide against me; they said: Well done, well done, our eyes have seen it.

22.verse: Thou hast seen, O Lord, be not thou silent: O Lord, depart not from me.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the servant of God, David himself.

2.verse: The unjust hath said within himself, that he would sin: there is no fear of God before his eyes.

3.verse: For in his sight he hath done deceitfully, that his iniquity may be found unto hatred.

4.verse: The words of his mouth are iniquity and guile: he would not understand that he might do well.

5.verse: He hath devised iniquity on his bed, he hath set himself on every way that is not good: but evil he hath not hated.

6.verse: O Lord, thy mercy is in heaven, and thy truth reacheth, even to the clouds.

7.verse: Thy justice is as the mountains of God, thy judgments are a great deep. Men and beasts thou wilt preserve, O Lord:

8.verse: O how hast thou multiplied thy mercy, O God! But the children of men shall put their trust under the covert of thy wings.

9.verse: They shall be inebriated with the plenty of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the torrent of thy pleasure.

10.verse: For with thee is the fountain of life; and in thy light we shall see light.

11.verse: Extend thy mercy to them that know thee, and thy justice to them that are right in heart.

12.verse: Let not the foot of pride come to me, and let not the hand of the sinner move me.

13.verse: There the workers of iniquity are fallen, they are cast out, and could not stand.

1.verse: A psalm for David himself. Be not emulous of evildoers; nor envy them that work iniquity.

2.verse: For they shall shortly wither away as grass, and as the green herbs shall quickly fall.

3.verse: Trust in the Lord, and do good, and dwell in the land, and thou shalt be fed with its riches.

4.verse: Delight in the Lord, and he will give thee the requests of thy heart.

5.verse: Commit thy way to the Lord, and trust in him, and he will do it.

6.verse: And he will bring forth thy justice as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

7.verse: Be subject to the Lord and pray to him Envy not the man who prospereth in his way; the man who doth unjust things.

8.verse: Cease from anger, and leave rage; have no emulation to do evil.

9.verse: For the evildoers shall be cut off: but they that wait upon the Lord shall inherit the land.

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: and thou shalt seek his place, and shalt not find it.

11.verse: But the meek shall inherit the land, and shall delight in abundance of peace.

12.verse: The sinner shall watch the just man: and shall gnash upon him with his teeth.

1.verse: A psalm for David, for a remembrance of the sabbath.

2.verse: Rebuke me not, O Lord, in thy indignation; nor chastise me in thy wrath.

3.verse: For thy arrows are fastened in me: and thy hand hath been strong upon me.

4.verse: There is no health in my flesh, because of thy wrath: there is no peace for my bones, because of my sins.

5.verse: For my iniquities are gone over my head: and as a heavy burden are become heavy upon me.

6.verse: My sores are putrified and corrupted, because of my foolishness.

7.verse: I am become miserable, and am bowed down even to the end: I walked sorrowful all the day long.

8.verse: For my loins are filled with illusions; and there is no health in my flesh.

9.verse: I am afflicted and humbled exceedingly: I roared with the groaning of my heart.

10.verse: Lord, all my desire is before thee, and my groaning is not hidden from thee.

11.verse: My heart is troubled, my strength hath left me, and the light of my eyes itself is not with me.

12.verse: My friends and my neighbours have drawn near, and stood against me. And they that were near me stood afar off:

13.verse: And they that sought my soul used violence. And they that sought evils to me spoke vain things, and studied deceits all the day long.

14.verse: But I, as a deaf man, heard not: and as a dumb man not opening his mouth.

15.verse: And I became as a man that heareth not: and that hath no reproofs in his mouth.

16.verse: For in thee, O Lord, have I hoped: thou wilt hear me, O Lord my God.

17.verse: For I said: Lest at any time my enemies rejoice over me: and whilst my feet are moved, they speak great things against me.

18.verse: For I am ready for scourges: and my sorrow is continually before me.

19.verse: For I will declare my iniquity: and I will think for my sin.

20.verse: But my enemies live, and are stronger that I: and they hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

21.verse: They that render evil for good, have detracted me, because I followed goodness.

22.verse: Forsake me not, O Lord my God: do not thou depart from me.

23.verse: Attend unto my help, O Lord, the God of my salvation.

1.verse: Unto the end, for Idithun himself, a canticle of David.

2.verse: I said: I will take heed to my ways: that I sin not with my tongue. I have set guard to my mouth, when the sinner stood against me.

3.verse: I was dumb, and was humbled, and kept silence from good things: and my sorrow was renewed.

4.verse: My heart grew hot within me: and in my meditation a fire shall flame out.

5.verse: I spoke with my tongue: O Lord, make me know my end. And what is the number of my days: that I may know what is wanting to me.

6.verse: Behold thou hast made my days measurable: and my substance is as nothing before thee. And indeed all things are vanity: every man living.

7.verse: Surely man passeth as an image: yea, and he is disquieted in vain. He storeth up: and he knoweth not for whom he shall gather these things.

8.verse: And now what is my hope? is it not the Lord? and my substance is with thee.

9.verse: Deliver thou me from all my iniquities: thou hast made me a reproach to the fool.

10.verse: I was dumb, and I opened not my mouth, because thou hast done it.

11.verse: Remove thy scourges from me. The strength of thy hand hath made me faint in rebukes:

12.verse: Thou hast corrected man for iniquity. And thou hast made his soul to waste away like a spider: surely in vain is any man disquieted.

13.verse: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and my supplication: give ear to my tears. Be not silent: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner as all my fathers were.

14.verse: O forgive me, that I may be refreshed, before I go hence, and be no more.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David himself.

2.verse: With expectation I have waited for the Lord, and he was attentive to me.

3.verse: And he heard my prayers, and brought me out of the pit of misery and the mire of dregs. And he set my feet upon a rock, and directed my steps.

4.verse: And he put a new canticle into my mouth, a song to our God. Many shall see, and shall fear: and they shall hope in the Lord.

5.verse: Blessed is the man whose trust is in the name of the Lord; and who hath not had regard to vanities, and lying follies.

6.verse: Thou hast multiplied thy wonderful works, O Lord my God: and in thy thoughts there is no one like to thee. I have declared and I have spoken they are multiplied above number.

7.verse: Sacrifice and oblation thou didst not desire; but thou hast pierced ears for me. Burnt offering and sin offering thou didst not require:

8.verse: Then said I, Behold I come. In the head of the book it is written of me

9.verse: That I should do thy will: O my God, I have desired it, and thy law in the midst of my heart.

10.verse: I have declared thy justice in a great church, lo, I will not restrain my lips: O Lord, thou knowest it.

11.verse: I have not hid thy justice within my heart: I have declared thy truth and thy salvation. I have not concealed thy mercy and thy truth from a great council.

12.verse: Withhold not thou, O Lord, thy tender mercies from me: thy mercy and thy truth have always upheld me.

13.verse: For evils without number have surrounded me; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I was not able to see. They are multiplied above the hairs of my head: and my heart hath forsaken me.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David himself.

2.verse: Blessed is he that understandeth concerning the needy and the poor: the Lord will deliver him in the evil day.

3.verse: The Lord preserve him and give him life, and make him blessed upon the earth: and deliver him not up to the will of his enemies.

4.verse: The Lord help him on his bed of sorrow: thou hast turned all his couch in his sickness.

5.verse: I said: O Lord, be thou merciful to me: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.

6.verse: My enemies have spoken evils against me: when shall he die and his name perish?

7.verse: And if he came in to see me, he spoke vain things: his heart gathered together iniquity to itself. He went out and spoke to the same purpose.

8.verse: All my enemies whispered together against me: they devised evils to me.

9.verse: They determined against me an unjust word: shall he that sleepeth rise again no more?

10.verse: For even the man of peace, in whom I trusted, who ate my bread, hath greatly supplanted me.

11.verse: But thou, O Lord, have mercy on me, and raise me up again: and I will requite them.

12.verse: By this I know, that thou hast had a good will for me: because my enemy shall not rejoice over me.

13.verse: But thou hast upheld me by reason of my innocence: and hast established me in thy sight for ever.

14.verse: Blessed by the Lord the God of Israel from eternity to eternity. So be it. So be it.

1.verse: Unto the end, understanding for the sons of Core.

2.verse: As the hart panteth after the fountains of water; so my soul panteth after thee, O God.

3.verse: My soul hath thirsted after the strong living God; when shall I come and appear before the face of God?

4.verse: My tears have been my bread day and night, whilst it is said to me daily: Where is thy God?

5.verse: These things I remembered, and poured out my soul in me: for I shall go over into the place of the wonderful tabernacle, even to the house of God: With the voice of joy and praise; the noise of one feasting.

6.verse: Why art thou sad, O my soul? and why dost thou trouble me? Hope in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance,

7.verse: And my God. My soul is troubled within myself: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan and Hermoniim, from the little hill.

8.verse: Deep calleth on deep, at the noise of thy flood-gates. All thy heights and thy billows have passed over me.

9.verse: In the daytime the Lord hath commanded his mercy; and a canticle to him in the night. With me is prayer to the God of my life.

10.verse: I will say to God: Thou art my support. Why hast thou forgotten me? and why go I mourning, whilst my enemy afflicteth me?

11.verse: Whilst my bones are broken, my enemies who trouble me have reproached me; Whilst they say to me day be day: Where is thy God?

12.verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why dost thou disquiet me? Hope thou in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance, and my God.

1.verse: A psalm for David. Judge me, O God, and distinguish my cause from the nation that is not holy: deliver me from the unjust and deceitful man.

2.verse: For thou art God my strength: why hast thou cast me off? and why do I go sorrowful whilst the enemy afflicteth me?

3.verse: Send forth thy light and thy truth: they have conducted me, and brought me unto thy holy hill, and into thy tabernacles.

4.verse: And I will go in to the altar of God: to God who giveth joy to my youth.

5.verse: To thee, O God my God, I will give praise upon the harp: why art thou sad, O my soul? and why dost thou disquiet me?

6.verse: Hope in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance, and my God.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, to give understanding.

2.verse: We have heard, O God, with our ears: our fathers have declared to us, The work, thou hast wrought in their days, and in the days of old.

3.verse: Thy hand destroyed the Gentiles, and thou plantedst them: thou didst afflict the people and cast them out.

4.verse: For they got not the possession of the land by their own sword: neither did their own arm save them. But thy right hand and thy arm, and the light of thy countenance: because thou wast pleased with them.

5.verse: Thou art thyself my king and my God, who commandest the saving of Jacob.

1.verse: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed, for the sons of Core, for understanding. A canticle for the Beloved.

2.verse: My heart hath uttered a good word I speak my works to the king; My tongue is the pen of a scrivener that writeth swiftly.

3.verse: Thou art beautiful above the sons of men: grace is poured abroad in thy lips; therefore hath God blessed thee for ever.

4.verse: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou most mighty.

5.verse: With thy comeliness and thy beauty set out, proceed prosperously, and reign. Because of truth and meekness and justice: and thy right hand shall conduct thee wonderfully.

6.verse: Thy arrows are sharp: under thee shall people fall, into the hearts of the king's enemies.

7.verse: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a sceptre of uprightness.

8.verse: Thou hast loved justice, and hated iniquity: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

9.verse: Myrrh and stacte and cassia perfume thy garments, from the ivory houses: out of which

10.verse: The daughters of kings have delighted thee in thy glory. The queen stood on thy right hand, in gilded clothing; surrounded with variety.

11.verse: Hearken, O daughter, and see, and incline thy ear: and forget thy people and thy father's house.

12.verse: And the king shall greatly desire thy beauty; for he is the Lord thy God, and him they shall adore.

13.verse: And the daughters of Tyre with gifts, yea, all the rich among the people, shall entreat thy countenance.

14.verse: All the glory of the king's daughter is within in golden borders,

15.verse: Clothed round about with varieties. After her shall virgins be brought to the king: her neighbours shall be brought to thee.

16.verse: They shall be brought with gladness and rejoicing: they shall be brought into the temple of the king.

17.verse: Instead of thy fathers, sons are born to thee: thou shalt make them princes over all the earth.

18.verse: They shall remember thy name throughout all generations. Therefore shall people praise thee for ever; yea, for ever and ever.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, for the hidden.

2.verse: Our God is our refuge and strength: a helper in troubles, which have found us exceedingly.

3.verse: Therefore we will not fear, when the earth shall be troubled; and the mountains shall be removed into the heart of the sea.

4.verse: Their waters roared and were troubled: the mountains were troubled with his strength.

5.verse: The stream of the river maketh the city of God joyful: the most High hath sanctified his own tabernacle.

6.verse: God is in the midst thereof, it shall not be moved: God will help it in the morning early.

7.verse: Nations were troubled, and kingdoms were bowed down: he uttered his voice, the earth trembled.

8.verse: The Lord of armies is with us: the God of Jacob is our protector.

9.verse: Come and behold ye the works of the Lord: what wonders he hath done upon earth,

10.verse: Making wars to cease even to the end of the earth. He shall destroy the bow, and break the weapons: and the shield he shall burn in the fire.

11.verse: Be still and see that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

12.verse: The Lord of armies is with us: the God of Jacob is our protector.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the sons of Core.

2.verse: O clap your hands, all ye nations: shout unto God with the voice of Joy,

3.verse: For the Lord is high, terrible: a great king over all the earth.

4.verse: He hath subdued the people under us; and the nations under our feet.

5.verse: He hath chosen for us his inheritance the beauty of Jacob which he hath loved.

6.verse: God is ascended with jubilee, and the Lord with the sound of trumpet.

7.verse: Sing praises to our God, sing ye: sing praises to our king, sing ye.

8.verse: For God is the king of all the earth: sing ye wisely.

9.verse: God shall reign over the nations: God sitteth on his holy throne.

1.verse: A psalm of a canticle, for the sons of Core, on the second day of the week.

2.verse: Great is the Lord, and exceedingly to be praised in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.

3.verse: With the joy of the whole earth is mount Sion founded, on the sides of the north, the city of the great king.

4.verse: In her houses shall God be known, when he shall protect her.

5.verse: For behold the kings of the earth assembled themselves: they gathered together.

6.verse: So they saw, and they wondered, they were troubled, they were moved:

7.verse: Trembling took hold of them. There were pains as of a woman in labour.

8.verse: With a vehement wind thou shalt break in pieces the ships of Tharsis.

9.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen, in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God hath founded it for ever.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for the sons of Core.

2.verse: Hear these things, all ye nations: give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.

3.verse: All you that are earthborn, and you sons of men: both rich and poor together.

4.verse: My mouth shall speak wisdom: and the meditation of my heart understanding.

5.verse: I will incline my ear to a parable; I will open my proposition on the psaltery.

6.verse: Why shall I fear in the evil day? the iniquity of my heel shall encompass me.

7.verse: They that trust in their own strength, and glory in the multitude of their riches,

8.verse: No brother can redeem, nor shall man redeem: he shall not give to God his ransom,

9.verse: Nor the price of the redemption of his soul: and shall labour for ever,

10.verse: And shall still live unto the end.

11.verse: He shall not see destruction, when he shall see the wise dying: the senseless and the fool shall perish together: And they shall leave their riches to strangers:

12.verse: And their sepulchres shall be their houses for ever. Their dwelling places to all generations: they have called their lands by their names.

13.verse: And man when he was in honour did not understand; he is compared to senseless beasts, and is become like to them.

14.verse: This way of theirs is a stumblingblock to them: and afterwards they shall delight in their mouth.

1.verse: A psalm for Asaph. The God of gods, the Lord hath spoken: and he hath called the earth. From the rising of the sun, to the going down thereof:

2.verse: Out of Sion the loveliness of his beauty.

3.verse: God shall come manifestly: our God shall come, and shall not keep silence. A fire shall burn before him: and a mighty tempest shall be round about him.

4.verse: He shall call heaven from above, and the earth, to judge his people.

5.verse: Gather ye together his saints to him: who set his covenant before sacrifices.

6.verse: And the heavens shall declare his justice: for God is judge.

7.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will speak: O Israel, and I will testify to thee: I am God, thy God.

8.verse: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices: and thy burnt offerings are always in my sight.

9.verse: I will not take calves out of thy house: nor he goats out of thy flocks.

10.verse: For all the beasts of the woods are mine: the cattle on the hills, and the oxen.

11.verse: I know all the fowls of the air: and with me is the beauty of the field.

12.verse: If I should be hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.

13.verse: Shall I eat the flesh of bullocks? or shall I drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: Offer to God the sacrifice of praise: and pay thy vows to the most High.

15.verse: And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.

16.verse: But to the sinner God hath said: Why dost thou declare my justices, and take my covenant in thy mouth?

17.verse: Seeing thou hast hated discipline: and hast cast my words behind thee.

18.verse: If thou didst see a thief thou didst run with him: and with adulterers thou hast been a partaker.

19.verse: Thy mouth hath abounded with evil, and thy tongue framed deceits.

20.verse: Sitting thou didst speak against thy brother, and didst lay a scandal against thy mother's son:

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm of David,

2.verse: When Nathan the prophet came to him after he had sinned with Bethsabee.

3.verse: Have mercy on me, O God, according to thy great mercy. And according to the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my iniquity.

4.verse: Wash me yet more from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

5.verse: For I know my iniquity, and my sin is always before me.

6.verse: To thee only have I sinned, and have done evil before thee: that thou mayst be justified in thy words and mayst overcome when thou art judged.

7.verse: For behold I was conceived in iniquities; and in sins did my mother conceive me.

8.verse: For behold thou hast loved truth: the uncertain and hidden things of thy wisdom thou hast made manifest to me.

9.verse: Thou shalt sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be cleansed: thou shalt wash me, and I shall be made whiter than snow.

10.verse: To my hearing thou shalt give joy and gladness: and the bones that have been humbled shall rejoice.

11.verse: Turn away thy face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.

12.verse: Create a clean heart in me, O God: and renew a right spirit within my bowels.

13.verse: Cast me not away from thy face; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

14.verse: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation, and strengthen me with a perfect spirit.

15.verse: I will teach the unjust thy ways: and the wicked shall be converted to thee.

16.verse: Deliver me from blood, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall extol thy justice.

17.verse: O Lord, thou wilt open my lips: and my mouth shall declare thy praise.

18.verse: For if thou hadst desired sacrifice, I would indeed have given it: with burnt offerings thou wilt not be delighted.

19.verse: A sacrifice to God is an afflicted spirit: a contrite and humbled heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

20.verse: Deal favourably, O Lord, in thy good will with Sion; that the walls of Jerusalem may be built up.

21.verse: Then shalt thou accept the sacrifice of justice, oblations and whole burnt offerings: then shall they lay calves upon thy altar.

1.verse: Unto the end, understanding for David,

2.verse: When Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul David went to the house of Achimelech. [1 Kings 22.]

3.verse: Why dost thou glory in malice, thou that art mighty in iniquity?

4.verse: All the day long thy tongue hath devised injustice: as a sharp razor, thou hast wrought deceit.

5.verse: Thou hast loved malice more than goodness: and iniquity rather than to speak righteousness.

6.verse: Thou hast loved all the words of ruin, O deceitful tongue.

7.verse: Therefore will God destroy thee for ever: he will pluck thee out, and remove thee from thy dwelling place: and thy root out of the land of the living.

8.verse: The just shall see and fear, and shall laugh at him, and say:

9.verse: Behold the man that made not God his helper: But trusted in the abundance of his riches: and prevailed in his vanity.

10.verse: But I, as a fruitful olive tree in the house of God, have hoped in the mercy of God for ever, yea for ever and ever.

11.verse: I will praise thee for ever, because thou hast done it: and I will wait on thy name, for it is good in the sight of thy saints.

1.verse: Unto the end, In verses, understanding for David.

2.verse: When the men of Ziph had come and said to Saul: Is not David hidden with us?

3.verse: Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me in thy strength.

4.verse: O God, hear my prayer: give ear to the words of my mouth.

5.verse: For strangers have risen up against me; and the mighty have sought after my soul: and they have not set God before their eyes.

6.verse: For behold God is my helper: and the Lord is the protector of my soul.

1.verse: Unto the end, in verses, understanding for David.

2.verse: Hear, O God, my prayer, and despise not my supplication:

3.verse: Be attentive to me and hear me. I am grieved in my exercise; and am troubled,

4.verse: At the voice of the enemy, and at the tribulation of the sinner. For they have cast iniquities upon me: and in wrath they were troublesome to me.

5.verse: My heart is troubled within me: and the fear of death is fallen upon me.

6.verse: Fear and trembling are come upon me: and darkness hath covered me.

7.verse: And I said: Who will give me wings like a dove, and I will fly and be at rest?

1.verse: Unto the end, for a people that is removed at a distance from the sanctuary for David, for an inscription of a title (or pillar) when the Philistines held him in Geth.

2.verse: Have mercy on me, O God, for man hath trodden me under foot; all the day long he hath afflicted me fighting against me.

3.verse: My enemies have trodden on me all the day long; for they are many that make war against me.

4.verse: From the height of the day I shall fear: but I will trust in thee.

5.verse: In God I will praise my words, in God I have put my trust: I will not fear what flesh can do against me.

6.verse: All the day long they detested my words: all their thoughts were against me unto evil.

7.verse: They will dwell and hide themselves: they will watch my heel. As they have waited for my soul,

8.verse: For nothing shalt thou save them: in thy anger thou shalt break the people in pieces, O God,

9.verse: I have declared to thee my life: thou hast set my tears in thy sight, As also in thy promise.

10.verse: Then shall my enemies be turned back. In what day soever I shall call upon thee, behold I know thou art my God.

11.verse: In God will I praise the word, in the Lord will I praise his speech. In God have I hoped, I will not fear what man can do to me.

12.verse: In me, O God, are vows to thee, which I will pay, praises to thee:

13.verse: Because thou hast delivered my soul from death, my feet from falling: that I may please in the sight of God, in the light of the living.

1.verse: Unto the end, destroy not, for David, for an inscription of a title, when he fled from Saul into the cave. [1 Kings 24.]

2.verse: Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me: for my soul trusteth in thee. And in the shadow of thy wings will I hope, until iniquity pass away.

3.verse: I will cry to God the most High; to God who hath done good to me.

4.verse: He hath sent from heaven and delivered me: he hath made them a reproach that trod upon me. God hath sent his mercy and his truth,

5.verse: And he hath delivered my soul from the midst of the young lions. I slept troubled. The sons of men, whose teeth are weapons and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

6.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory above all the earth.

7.verse: They prepared a snare for my feet; and they bowed down my soul. They dug a pit before my face, and they are fallen into it.

8.verse: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will Sing, and rehearse a psalm.

9.verse: Arise, O my glory, arise psaltery and harp: I will arise early.

10.verse: I will give praise to thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing a psalm to thee among the nations.

11.verse: For thy mercy is magnified even to the heavens: and thy truth unto the clouds.

12.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth.

1.verse: Unto the end, destroy not, for David, for an inscription of a title.

2.verse: If in very deed you speak justice: judge right things, ye sons of men.

3.verse: For in your heart you work iniquity: your hands forge injustice in the earth.

4.verse: The wicked are alienated from the womb; they have gone astray from the womb: they have spoken false things.

5.verse: Their madness is according to the likeness of a serpent: like the deaf asp that stoppeth her ears:

6.verse: Which will not hear the voice of the charmers; nor of the wizard that charmeth wisely.

7.verse: God shall break in pieces their teeth in their mouth: the Lord shall break the grinders of the lions.

8.verse: They shall come to nothing, like water running down; he hath bent his bow till they be weakened.

9.verse: Like wax that melteth they shall be taken away: fire hath fallen on them, and they shall not see the sun.

10.verse: Before your thorns could know the brier; he swalloweth them up, as alive, in his wrath.

11.verse: The just shall rejoice when he shall see the revenge: he shall wash his hands in the blood of the sinner.

1.verse: Unto the end, destroy not, for David for an inscription of It title, when Saul sent and watched his house to kill him.

2.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; and defend me from them that rise up against me.

3.verse: Deliver me from them that work iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

4.verse: For behold they have caught my soul: the mighty have rushed in upon me:

5.verse: Neither is it my iniquity, nor my sin, O Lord: without iniquity have I run, and directed my steps.

6.verse: Rise up thou to meet me, and behold: even thou, O Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel. Attend to visit all the nations: have no mercy on all them that work iniquity.

7.verse: They shall return at evening, and shall suffer hunger like dogs: and shall go round about the city.

8.verse: Behold they shall speak with their mouth, and a sword is in their lips: for who, say they, hath heard us?

9.verse: But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them: thou shalt bring all the nations to nothing.

10.verse: I will keep my strength to thee: for thou art my protector:

11.verse: My God, his mercy shall prevent me.

1.verse: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed, for the inscription of a title, to David himself, for doctrine,

2.verse: When he set fire to Mesopotamia of Syria and Sobal and Joab returned and slew of Edom, in the vale of the saltpits, twelve thousand men.

3.verse: O God, thou hast cast us off, and hast destroyed us; thou hast been angry, and hast had mercy on us.

4.verse: Thou hast moved the earth, and hast troubled it: heal thou the breaches thereof, for it has been moved.

5.verse: Thou hast shewn thy people hard things; thou hast made us drink wine of sorrow.

6.verse: Thou hast given a warning to them that fear thee: that they may flee from before the bow: That thy beloved may be delivered.

7.verse: Save me with thy right hand, and hear me.

8.verse: God hath spoken in his holy place: I will rejoice, and I will divide Sichem; and will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

9.verse: Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine: and Ephraim is the strength of my head. Juda is my king:

10.verse: Moab is the pot of my hope. Into Edom will I stretch out my shoe: to me the foreigners are made subject.

11.verse: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

12.verse: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go out with our armies?

13.verse: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the salvation of man.

14.verse: Through God we shall do mightily: and he shall bring to nothing them that afflict us.

4.verse: For thou hast been my hope; a tower of strength against the face of the enemy.

1.verse: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of David.

2.verse: Shall not my soul be subject to God? for from him is my salvation.

3.verse: For he is my God and my saviour: he is my protector, I shall be moved no more.

4.verse: How long do you rush in upon a man? you all kill, as if you were thrusting down a leaning wall, and a tottering fence.

5.verse: But they have thought to cast away my price; I ran in thirst: they blessed with their mouth, but cursed with their heart.

6.verse: But be thou, O my soul, subject to God: for from him is my patience.

7.verse: For he is my God and my saviour: he is my helper, I shall not be moved.

8.verse: In God is my salvation and my glory: he is the God of my help, and my hope is in God.

1.verse: A psalm of David when he was in the desert of Edom.

2.verse: O God, my God, to thee do I watch at break of day. For thee my soul hath thirsted; for thee my flesh, O how many ways!

3.verse: In a desert land, and where there is no way, and no water: so in the sanctuary have I come before thee, to see thy power and thy glory.

4.verse: For thy mercy is better than lives: thee my lips shall praise.

5.verse: Thus will I bless thee all my life long: and in thy name I will lift up my hands.

6.verse: Let my soul be filled as with marrow and fatness: and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips.

7.verse: If I have remembered thee upon my bed, I will meditate on thee in the morning:

8.verse: Because thou hast been my helper. And I will rejoice under the covert of thy wings:

9.verse: My soul hath stuck close to thee: thy right hand hath received me.

10.verse: But they have sought my soul in vain, they shall go into the lower parts of the earth:

11.verse: They shall be delivered into the hands of the sword, they shall be the portions of foxes.

12.verse: But the king shall rejoice in God, all they shall be praised that swear by him: because the mouth is stopped of them that speak wicked things.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

2.verse: Hear, O God, my prayer, when I make supplication to thee: deliver my soul from the fear of the enemy.

3.verse: Thou hast protected me from the assembly of the malignant; from the multitude of the workers of iniquity.

4.verse: For they have whetted their tongues like a sword; they have bent their bow a bitter thing,

5.verse: To shoot in secret the undefiled.

6.verse: They will shoot at him on a sudden, and will not fear: they are resolute in wickedness. They have talked of hiding snares; they have said: Who shall see them?

7.verse: They have searched after iniquities: they have failed in their search. Man shall come to a deep heart:

8.verse: And God shall be exalted. The arrows of children are their wounds:

9.verse: And their tongues against them are made weak. All that saw them were troubled;

10.verse: And every man was afraid. And they declared the works of God: and understood his doings.

11.verse: The just shall rejoice in the Lord, and shall hope in him: and all the upright in heart shall be praised.

1.verse: To the end, a psalm of David. The canticle of Jeremias and Ezechiel to the people of the captivity, when they began to go out.

2.verse: A Hymn, O God, becometh thee in Sion: and a vow shall be paid to thee in Jerusalem.

3.verse: O hear my prayer: all flesh shall come to thee.

4.verse: The words of the wicked have prevailed over us: and thou wilt pardon our transgressions.

5.verse: Blessed is he whom thou hast chosen and taken to thee: he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be filled with the good things of thy house; holy is thy temple,

6.verse: Wonderful in justice. Hear us, O God our saviour, who art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and in the sea afar off.

7.verse: Thou who preparest the mountains by thy strength, being girded with power:

8.verse: Who troublest the depth of the sea, the noise of its waves. The Gentiles shall be troubled,

9.verse: And they that dwell in the uttermost borders shall be afraid at thy signs: thou shalt make the outgoings of the morning and of the evening to be joyful.

10.verse: Thou hast visited the earth, and hast plentifully watered it; thou hast many ways enriched it. The river of God is filled with water, thou hast prepared their food: for so is its preparation.

1.verse: Unto the end, a canticle of a psalm of the resurrection. Shout with joy to God, all the earth,

2.verse: Sing ye a psalm to his name; give glory to his praise.

3.verse: Say unto God, How terrible are thy works, O Lord! in the multitude of thy strength thy enemies shall lie to thee.

4.verse: Let all the earth adore thee, and sing to thee: let it sing a psalm to thy name.

5.verse: Come and see the works of God; who is terrible in his counsels over the sons of men.

6.verse: Who turneth the sea into dry land, in the river they shall pass on foot: there shall we rejoice in him.

7.verse: Who by his power ruleth for ever: his eyes behold the nations; let not them that provoke him he exalted in themselves.

8.verse: O bless our God, ye Gentiles: and make the voice of his praise to be heard.

9.verse: Who hath set my soul to live: and hath not suffered my feet to be moved:

10.verse: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us by fire, as silver is tried.

11.verse: Thou hast brought us into a net, thou hast laid afflictions on our back:

12.verse: Thou hast set men over our heads. We have passed through fire and water, and thou hast brought us out into a refreshment.

13.verse: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

1.verse: Unto the end, in, hymns, a psalm of a canticle for David.

2.verse: May God have mercy on us, and bless us: may he cause the light of his countenance to shine upon us, and may he have mercy on us.

3.verse: That we may know thy way upon earth: thy salvation in all nations.

4.verse: Let people confess to thee, O God: let all people give praise to thee.

5.verse: Let the nations be glad and rejoice: for thou judgest the people with justice, and directest the nations upon earth.

6.verse: Let the people, O God, confess to thee: let all the people give praise to thee:

7.verse: The earth hath yielded her fruit. May God, our God bless us,

8.verse: May God bless us: and all the ends of the earth fear him.
