1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm of a canticle for David himself.

2.verse: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered: and let them that hate him flee from before his face.

3.verse: As smoke vanisheth, so let them vanish away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

4.verse: And let the just feast, and rejoice before God: and be delighted with gladness.

5.verse: Sing ye to God, sing a psalm to his name, make a way for him who ascendeth upon the west: the Lord is his name. Rejoice ye before him: but the wicked shall be troubled at his presence,

6.verse: Who is the father of orphans, and the judge of widows. God in his holy place:

7.verse: God who maketh men of one manner to dwell in a house: Who bringeth out them that were bound in strength; in like manner them that provoke, that dwell in sepulchres.

1.verse: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed; for David.

2.verse: SAVE me, O God: for the waters are come in even unto my soul.

3.verse: I stick fast in the mire of the deep: and there is no sure standing. I am come into the depth of the sea: and a tempest hath overwhelmed me.

4.verse: I have laboured with crying; my jaws are become hoarse: my eyes have failed, whilst I hope in my God.

5.verse: They are multiplied above the hairs of my head, who hate me without cause. My enemies are grown strong who have wrongfully persecuted me: then did I pay that which I took not away.

6.verse: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my offences are not hidden from thee:

7.verse: Let not them be ashamed for me, who look for thee, O Lord, the Lord of hosts. Let them not be confounded on my account, who seek thee, O God of Israel.

8.verse: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

9.verse: I am become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to the sons of my mother.

10.verse: For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up: and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

11.verse: And I covered my soul in fasting: and it was made a reproach to me.

12.verse: And I made haircloth my garment: and I became a byword to them.

13.verse: They that sat in the gate spoke against me: and they that drank wine made me their song.

14.verse: But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O Lord; for the time of thy good pleasure, O God. In the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

15.verse: Draw me out of the mire, that I may not stick fast: deliver me from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

16.verse: Let not the tempest of water drown me, nor the deep swallow me up: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

17.verse: Hear me, O Lord, for thy mercy is kind; look upon me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

18.verse: And turn not away thy face from thy servant: for I am in trouble, hear me speedily.

19.verse: Attend to my soul, and deliver it: save me because of my enemies.

20.verse: Thou knowest my reproach, and my confusion, and my shame.

21.verse: In thy sight are all they that afflict me; my heart hath expected reproach and misery. And I looked for one that would grieve together with me, but there was none: and for one that would comfort me, and I found none.

22.verse: And they gave me gall for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.verse: Let their table become as a snare before them, and a recompense, and a stumblingblock.

24.verse: Let their eyes be darkened that they see not; and their back bend thou down always.

25.verse: Pour out thy indignation upon them: and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

26.verse: Let their habitation be made desolate: and let there be none to dwell in their tabernacles.

27.verse: Because they have persecuted him whom thou hast smitten; and they have added to the grief of my wounds.

28.verse: Add thou iniquity upon their iniquity: and let them not come into thy justice.

29.verse: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living; and with the just let them not be written.

30.verse: But I am poor and sorrowful: thy salvation, O God, hath set me up.

31.verse: I will praise the name of God with a canticle: and I will magnify him with praise.

32.verse: And it shall please God better than a young calf, that bringeth forth horns and hoofs.

33.verse: Let the poor see and rejoice: seek ye God, and your soul shall live.

34.verse: For the Lord hath heard the poor: and hath not despised his prisoners.

35.verse: Let the heavens and the earth praise him; the sea, and every thing that creepeth therein.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David, to bring to remembrance that the Lord saved him.

2.verse: O God, come to my assistance; O Lord, make haste to help me.

3.verse: Let them be confounded and ashamed that seek my soul:

4.verse: Let them be turned backward, and blush for shame that desire evils to me: Let them be presently turned away blushing for shame that say to me: Tis well, tis well.

5.verse: Let all that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee; and let such as love thy salvation say always: The Lord be magnified.

6.verse: But I am needy and poor; O God, help me. Thou art my helper and my deliverer: O Lord, make no delay.

1.verse: A psalm for David. Of the sons of Jonadab, and the former captives. In thee, O Lord, I have hoped, let me never be put to confusion:

2.verse: Deliver me in thy justice, and rescue me. Incline thy ear unto me, and save me.

3.verse: Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a place of strength: that thou mayst make me safe. For thou art my firmament and my refuge.

4.verse: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the sinner, and out of the hand of the transgressor of the law and of the unjust.

5.verse: For thou art my patience, O Lord: my hope, O Lord, from my youth;

1.verse: A psalm on Solomon.

2.verse: Give to the king thy judgment, O God: and to the king's son thy justice: To judge thy people with justice, and thy poor with judgment.

3.verse: Let the mountains receive peace for the people: and the hills justice.

4.verse: He shall judge the poor of the people, and he shall save the children of the poor: and he shall humble the oppressor.

5.verse: And he shall continue with the sun, and before the moon, throughout all generations.

6.verse: He shall come down like rain upon the fleece; and as showers falling gently upon the earth.

7.verse: In his days shall justice spring up, and abundance of peace, till the moon be taken sway.

8.verse: And he shall rule from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

9.verse: Before him the Ethiopians shall fall down: and his enemies shall lick the ground.

10.verse: The kings of Tharsis and the islands shall offer presents: the kings of the Arabians and of Saba shall bring gifts:

11.verse: And all kings of the earth shall adore him: all nations shall serve him.

12.verse: For he shall deliver the poor from the mighty: and the needy that had no helper.

13.verse: He shall spare the poor and needy: and he shall save the souls of the poor.

14.verse: He shall redeem their souls from usuries and iniquity: and their names shall be honourable in his sight.

15.verse: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Arabia, for him they shall always adore: they shall bless him all the day.

16.verse: And there shall be a firmament on the earth on the tops of mountains, above Libanus shall the fruit thereof be exalted: and they of the city shall flourish like the grass of the earth.

17.verse: Let his name be blessed for evermore: his name continueth before the sun. And in him shall all the tribes of the earth be blessed: all nations shall magnify him.

18.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who alone doth wonderful things.

19.verse: And blessed be the name of his majesty for ever: and the whole earth shall be filled with his majesty. So be it. So be it.

20.verse: The praises of David, the son of Jesse, are ended.

1.verse: A psalm for Asaph. How good is God to Israel, to them that are of a right heart!

2.verse: But my feet were almost moved; my steps had well nigh slipped.

3.verse: Because I had a zeal on occasion of the wicked, seeing the prosperity of sinners.

4.verse: For there is no regard to their death, nor is there strength in their stripes.

5.verse: They are not in the labour of men: neither shall they be scourged like other men.

6.verse: Therefore pride hath held them fast: they are covered with their iniquity and their wickedness.

7.verse: Their iniquity hath come forth, as it were from fatness: they have passed into the affection of the heart.

8.verse: They have thought and spoken wickedness: they have spoken iniquity on high.

9.verse: They have set their mouth against heaven: and their tongue hath passed through the earth.

10.verse: Therefore will my people return here and full days shall be found in them.

11.verse: And they said: How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

12.verse: Behold these are sinners; and yet abounding in the world they have obtained riches.

13.verse: And I said: Then have I in vain justified my heart, and washed my hands among the innocent.

14.verse: And I have been scourged all the day; and my chastisement hath been in the mornings.

15.verse: If I said: I will speak thus; behold I should condemn the generation of thy children.

16.verse: I studied that I might know this thing, it is a labour in my sight:

17.verse: Until I go into the sanctuary of God, and understand concerning their last ends.

18.verse: But indeed for deceits thou hast put it to them: when they were lifted up thou hast cast them down.

19.verse: How are they brought to desolation? they have suddenly ceased to be: they have perished by reason of their iniquity.

20.verse: As the dream of them that awake, O Lord; so in thy city thou shalt bring their image to nothing.

1.verse: Understanding for Asaph. O God, why hast thou cast us off unto the end: why is thy wrath enkindled against the sheep of thy pasture?

2.verse: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast possessed from the beginning. The sceptre of thy inheritance which thou hast redeemed: mount Sion in which thou hast dwelt.

3.verse: Lift up thy hands against their pride unto the end; see what things the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

4.verse: And they that hate thee have made their boasts, in the midst of thy solemnity. They have set up their ensigns for signs,

5.verse: And they knew not both in the going out and on the highest top. As with axes in a wood of trees,

6.verse: They have cut down at once the gates thereof, with axe and hatchet they have brought it down.

7.verse: They have set fire to thy sanctuary: they have defiled the dwelling place of thy name on the earth.

8.verse: They said in their heart, the whole kindred of them together: Let us abolish all the festival days of God from the land.

9.verse: Our signs we have not seen, there is now no prophet: and he will know us no more.

10.verse: How long, O God, shall the enemy reproach: is the adversary to provoke thy name for ever?

11.verse: Why dost thou turn away thy hand: and thy right hand out of the midst of thy bosom for ever?

12.verse: But God is our king before ages: he hath wrought salvation in the midst of the earth.

13.verse: Thou by thy strength didst make the sea firm: thou didst crush the heads of the dragons in the waters.

14.verse: Thou hast broken the heads of the dragon: thou hast given him to be meat for the people of the Ethiopians.

15.verse: Thou hast broken up the fountains and the torrents: thou hast dried up the Ethan rivers.

16.verse: Thine is the day, and thine is the night: thou hast made the morning light and the sun.

17.verse: Thou hast made all the borders of the earth: the summer and the spring were formed by thee.

18.verse: Remember this, the enemy hath reproached the Lord: and a foolish people hath provoked thy name.

19.verse: Deliver not up to beasts the souls that confess to thee: and forget not to the end the souls of thy poor.

20.verse: Have regard to thy covenant: for they that are the obscure of the earth have been filled with dwellings of iniquity.

21.verse: Let not the humble be turned away with confusion: the poor and needy shall praise thy name.

22.verse: Arise, O God, judge thy own cause: remember thy reproaches with which the foolish man hath reproached thee all the day.

23.verse: Forget not the voices of thy enemies: the pride of them that hate thee ascendeth continually.

1.verse: Unto the end, corrupt not, a psalm of a canticle for Asaph.

2.verse: We will praise thee, O God: we will praise, and we will call upon thy name. We will relate thy wondrous works:

3.verse: When I shall take a time, I will judge justices.

4.verse: The earth is melted, and all that dwell therein: I have established the pillars thereof.

5.verse: I said to the wicked: Do not act wickedly: and to the sinners: Lift not up the horn.

6.verse: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not iniquity against God.

7.verse: For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the desert hills:

8.verse: For God is the judge. One he putteth down, and another he lifteth up:

9.verse: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup of strong wine full of mixture. And he hath poured it out from this to that: but the dregs thereof are not emptied: all the sinners of the earth shall drink.

10.verse: But I will declare for ever: I will sing to the God of Jacob.

11.verse: And I will break all the horns of sinners: but the horns of the just shall be exalted.

1.verse: Unto the end, in praises, a psalm for Asaph: a canticle to the Assyrians.

2.verse: In Judea God is known: his name is great in Israel.

3.verse: And his place is in peace: and his abode in Sion:

4.verse: There hath he broken the powers of bows, the shield, the sword, and the battie.

5.verse: Thou enlightenest wonderfully from the everlasting hills.

6.verse: All the foolish of heart were troubled. They have slept their sleep; and all the men of riches have found nothing in their hands.

7.verse: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, they have all slumbered that mounted on horseback.

8.verse: Thou art terrible, and who shall resist thee? from that time thy wrath.

9.verse: Thou hast caused judgment to be heard from heaven: the earth trembled and was still,

10.verse: When God arose in judgment, to save all the meek of the earth.

1.verse: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: I cried to the Lord with my voice; to God with my voice, and he gave ear to me.

3.verse: In the day of my trouble I sought God, with my hands lifted up to him in the night, and I was not deceived. My soul refused to be comforted:

4.verse: I remembered God, and was delighted, and was exercised, and my spirit swooned away.

5.verse: My eyes prevented the watches: I was troubled, and I spoke not.

6.verse: I thought upon the days of old: and I had in my mind the eternal years.

7.verse: And I meditated in the night with my own heart: and I was exercised and I swept my spirit.

8.verse: Will God then cast off for ever? or will he never be more favourable again?

9.verse: Or will he cut off his mercy for ever, from generation to generation?

10.verse: Or will God forget to shew mercy? or will he in his anger shut up his mercies?

11.verse: And I said, Now have I begun: this is the change of the right hand of the most High.

12.verse: I remembered the works of the Lord: for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.

1.verse: Understanding for Asaph. Attend, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.verse: I will open my mouth in parables: I will utter propositions from the beginning.

3.verse: How great things have we heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

4.verse: They have not been hidden from their children, in another generation. Declaring the praises of the Lord, and his powers, and his wonders which he hath done.

5.verse: And he set up a testimony in Jacob: and made a law in Israel. How great things he commanded our fathers, that they should make the same known to their children:

6.verse: That another generation might know them. The children that should be born and should rise up, and declare them to their children.

7.verse: That they may put their hope in God and may not forget the works of God: and may seek his commandments.

8.verse: That they may not become like their fathers, a perverse and exasperating generation. A generation that set not their heart aright: and whose spirit was not faithful to God.

9.verse: The sons of Ephraim who bend and shoot with the bow: they have turned back in the day of battle.

10.verse: They kept not the covenant of God: and in his law they would not walk.

11.verse: And they forgot his benefits, and his wonders that he had shewn them.

12.verse: Wonderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Tanis.

13.verse: He divided the sea and brought them through: and he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.

14.verse: And he conducted them with a cloud by day: and all the night with a light of fire.

15.verse: He struck the rock in the wilderness: and gave them to drink, as out of the great deep.

16.verse: He brought forth water out of the rock: and made streams run down as rivers.

17.verse: And they added yet more sin against him: they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.

18.verse: And they tempted God in their hearts, by asking meat for their desires.

19.verse: And they spoke ill of God: they said: Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

20.verse: Because he struck the rock, and the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed. Can he also give bread, or provide a table for his people?

1.verse: A psalm for Asaph. O God, the heathens are come into thy inheritance, they have defiled thy holy temple: they have made Jerusalem as a place to keep fruit.

2.verse: They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be meat for the fowls of the air: the flesh of thy saints for the beasts of the earth.

3.verse: They have poured out their blood as water, round about Jerusalem and there was none to bury them.

4.verse: We are become a reproach to our neighbours: a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

5.verse: How long, O Lord, wilt thou be angry for ever: shall thy zeal be kindled like a fire?

6.verse: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that have not known thee: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

7.verse: Because they have devoured Jacob; and have laid waste his place.

8.verse: Remember not our former iniquities: let thy mercies speedily prevent us, for we are become exceeding poor.

9.verse: Help us, O God, our saviour: and for the glory of thy name, O Lord, deliver us: and forgive us our sins for thy name's sake:

10.verse: Lest they should say among the Gentiles: Where is their God? And let him be made known among the nations before our eyes, By the revenging the blood of thy servants, which hath been shed:

11.verse: Let the sighing of the prisoners come in before thee. According to the greatness of thy arm, take possession of the children of them that have been put to death.

12.verse: And render to our neighbours sevenfold in their bosom: the reproach wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.

13.verse: But we thy people, and the sheep of thy pasture, will give thanks to thee for ever. We will shew forth thy praise, unto generation and generation.

1.verse: Unto the end, for them that shall he changed, a testimony for Asaph, a psalm.

2.verse: Give ear, O thou that rulest Israel: thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep. Thou that sittest upon the cherubims, shine forth

3.verse: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses. Stir up thy might, and come to save us.

4.verse: Convert us, O God: and shew us thy face, and we shall be saved.

5.verse: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy servant?

6.verse: How long wilt thou feed us with the bread of tears: and give us for our drink tears in measure?

7.verse: Thou hast made us to be a contradiction to our neighbours: and our enemies have scoffed at us.

8.verse: O God of hosts, convert us: and shew thy face, and we shall be saved.

9.verse: Thou hast brought a vineyard out of Egypt: thou hast cast cut the Gentiles and planted it.

10.verse: Thou wast the guide of its journey in its sight: thou plantedst the roots thereof, and it filled the land.

11.verse: The shadow of it covered the hills: and the branches thereof the cedars of God.

12.verse: It stretched forth its branches unto the sea, and its boughs unto the river.

13.verse: Why hast thou broken down the hedge thereof, so that all they who pass by the way do pluck it?

1.verse: Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for Asaph himself.

2.verse: Rejoice to God our helper: sing aloud to the God of Jacob.

3.verse: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel: the pleasant psaltery with the harp.

4.verse: Blow up the trumpet on the new moon, on the noted day of your solemnity.

5.verse: For it is a commandment in Israel, and a judgment to the God of Jacob.

6.verse: He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt: he heard a tongue which he knew not.

7.verse: He removed his back from the burdens: his hands had served in baskets.

8.verse: Thou calledst upon me in affliction, and I delivered thee: I heard thee in the secret place of tempest: I proved thee at the waters of contradiction.

9.verse: Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me,

10.verse: There shall be no new god in thee: neither shalt thou adore a strange god.

11.verse: For I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

12.verse: But my people heard not my voice: and Israel hearkened not to me.

13.verse: So I let them go according to the desires of their heart: they shall walk in their own inventions.

14.verse: If my people had heard me: if Israel had walked in my ways:

15.verse: I should soon have humbled their enemies, and laid my hand on them that troubled them.

16.verse: The enemies of the Lord have lied to him: and their time shall be for ever.

17.verse: And he fed them with the fat of wheat, and filled them with honey out of the rock.

4.verse: Rescue the poor; and deliver the needy out of the hand of the sinner.

5.verse: They have not known nor understood: they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth shall be moved.

6.verse: I have said: You are gods and all of you the sons of the most High.

7.verse: But you like men shall die: and shall fall like one of the princes.

8.verse: Arise, O God, judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit among all the nations.

1.verse: A canticle of a psalm for Asaph.

2.verse: O God, who shall be like to thee? hold not thy peace, neither be thou still, O God.

3.verse: For lo, thy enemies have made a noise: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

4.verse: They have taken a malicious counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy saints.

5.verse: They have said: Come and let us destroy them, so that they be not a nation: and let the name of Israel be remembered no more.

6.verse: For they have contrived with one consent: they have made a covenant together against thee,

7.verse: The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ismahelites: Moab, and the Agarens,

8.verse: Gebal, and Ammon and Amalec: the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for the sons of Core.

2.verse: How lovely are thy tabernacles, O Lord of host!

3.verse: My soul longeth and fainteth for the courts of the Lord. My heart and my flesh have rejoiced in the living God.

4.verse: For the sparrow hath found herself a house, and the turtle a nest for herself where she may lay her young ones: Thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God.

5.verse: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house, O Lord: they shall praise thee for ever and ever.

6.verse: Blessed is the man whose help is from thee: in his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps,

7.verse: In the vale of tears, in the place which be hath set.

8.verse: For the lawgiver shall give a blessing, they shall go from virtue to virtue: the God of gods shall be seen in Sion.

9.verse: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob.

10.verse: Behold, O God our protector: and look on the face of thy Christ.

11.verse: For better is one day in thy courts above thousands. I have chosen to be an abject in the house of my God, rather than to dwell in the tabernacles of sinners.

12.verse: For God loveth mercy and truth: the Lord will give grace and glory.

13.verse: He will not deprive of good things them that walk in innocence: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

1.verse: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, a psalm.

2.verse: Lord, thou hast blessed thy land: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

3.verse: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people: thou hast covered all their sins.

4.verse: Thou hast mitigated all thy anger: thou hast turned away from the wrath of thy indignation.

5.verse: Convert us, O God our saviour: and turn off thy anger from us.

6.verse: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever: or wilt thou extend thy wrath from generation to generation?

7.verse: Thou wilt turn, O God, and bring us to life: and thy people shall rejoice in thee.

8.verse: shew us, O Lord, thy mercy; and grant us thy salvation.

9.verse: I will hear what the Lord God will speak in me: for he will speak peace unto his people: And unto his saints: and unto them that are converted to the heart.

10.verse: Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him: that glory may dwell in our land.

11.verse: Mercy and truth have met each other: justice and peace have kissed.

12.verse: Truth is sprung out of the earth: and justice hath looked down from heaven.

1.verse: A prayer for David himself. Incline thy ear, O Lord, and hear me: for I am needy and poor.

2.verse: Preserve my soul, for I am holy: save thy servant, O my God, that trusteth in thee.

3.verse: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I have cried to thee all the day.

4.verse: Give joy to the soul of thy servant, for to thee, O Lord, I have lifted up my soul.

5.verse: For thou, O Lord, art sweet and mild: and plenteous in mercy to all that call upon thee.

6.verse: Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer: and attend to the voice of my petition.

7.verse: I have called upon thee in the day of my trouble: because thou hast heard me.

8.verse: There is none among the gods like unto thee, O Lord: and there is none according to thy works.

9.verse: All the nations thou hast made shall come and adore before thee, O Lord: and they shall glorify thy name.

10.verse: For thou art great and dost wonderful things: thou art God alone.

11.verse: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy way, and I will walk in thy truth: let my heart rejoice that it may fear thy name.

12.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord my God: with my whole heart, and I will glorify thy name for ever:

13.verse: For thy mercy is great towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul out of the lower hell.

2.verse: The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.

4.verse: I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold the foreigners, and Tyre, and the people of the Ethiopians, these were there.

5.verse: Shall not Sion say: This man and that man is born in her? and the Highest himself hath founded her.

6.verse: The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes, of them that have been in her.

7.verse: The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing.

1.verse: A canticle of a psalm for the sons of Core: unto the end, for Maheleth, to answer understanding of Eman the Ezrahite.

2.verse: O Lord, the God of my salvation: I have cried in the day, and in the night before thee.

3.verse: Let my prayer come in before thee: incline thy ear to my petition.

4.verse: For my soul is filled with evils: and my life hath drawn nigh to hell.

5.verse: I am counted among them that go down to the pit: I am become as a man without help,

6.verse: Free among the dead. Like the slain sleeping in the sepulchres, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cast off from thy hand.

7.verse: They have laid me in the lower pit: in the dark places, and in the shadow of death.

1.verse: Of understanding, for Ethan the Ezrahite.

2.verse: The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever. I will shew forth thy truth with my mouth to generation and generation.

3.verse: For thou hast said: Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens: thy truth shall be prepared in them.

4.verse: I have made a covenant with my elect: I have sworn to David my servant:

5.verse: Thy seed will I settle for ever. And I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation.

6.verse: The heavens shall confess thy wonders, O Lord: and thy truth in the church of the saints.

7.verse: For who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord: or who among the sons of God shall be like to God?

8.verse: God, who is glorified in the assembly of the saints: great and terrible above all them that are about him.

9.verse: O Lord God of hosts, who is like to thee? thou art mighty, O Lord, and thy truth is round about thee.

10.verse: Thou rulest the power of the sea: and appeasest the motion of the waves thereof.

11.verse: Thou hast humbled the proud one, as one that is slain: with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.

12.verse: Thine are the heavens, and thine is the earth: the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded:

13.verse: The north and the sea thou hast created. Thabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name:

14.verse: Thy arm is with might. Let thy hand be strengthened, and thy right hand exalted:

15.verse: Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne. Mercy and truth shall go before thy face:

16.verse: Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation. They shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance:

17.verse: And in thy name they shall rejoice all the day, and in thy justice they shall be exalted.

18.verse: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted.

1.verse: A prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our refuge from generation to generation.

2.verse: Before the mountains were made, or the earth and the world was formed; from eternity and to eternity thou art God.

3.verse: Turn not man away to be brought low: and thou hast said: Be converted, O ye sons of men.

4.verse: For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday, which is past. And as a watch in the night,

5.verse: Things that are counted nothing, shall their years be.

6.verse: In the morning man shall grow up like grass; in the morning he shall flourish and pass away: in the evening he shall fall, grow dry, and wither.

7.verse: For in thy wrath we have fainted away: and are troubled in thy indignation.

8.verse: Thou hast set our iniquities before thy eyes: our life in the light of thy countenance.

9.verse: For all our days are spent; and in thy wrath we have fainted away. Our years shall be considered as a spider:

10.verse: The days of our years in them are threescore and ten years. But if in the strong they be fourscore years: and what is more of them is labour and sorrow. For mildness is come upon us: and we shall be corrected.

11.verse: Who knoweth the power of thy anger, and for thy fear

12.verse: Can number thy wrath? So make thy right hand known: and men learned in heart, in wisdom.

13.verse: Return, O Lord, how long? and be entreated in favour of thy servants.

14.verse: We are filled in the morning with thy mercy: and we have rejoiced, and are delighted all our days.

15.verse: We have rejoiced for the days in which thou hast humbled us: for the years in which we have seen evils.

16.verse: Look upon thy servants and upon their works: and direct their children.

17.verse: And let the brightness of the Lord our God be upon us: and direct thou the works of our hands over us; yea, the work of our hands do thou direct.

1.verse: The praise of a canticle for David. He that dwelleth in the aid of the most High, shall abide under the protection of the God of Jacob.

2.verse: He shall say to the Lord: Thou art my protector, and my refuge: my God, in him will I trust.

3.verse: For he hath delivered me from the snare of the hunters: and from the sharp word.

4.verse: He will overshadow thee with his shoulders: and under his wings thou shalt trust.

5.verse: His truth shall compass thee with a shield: thou shalt not be afraid of the terror of the night.

6.verse: Of the arrow that flieth in the day, of the business that walketh about in the dark: of invasion, or of the noonday devil.

7.verse: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not come nigh thee.

8.verse: But thou shalt consider with thy eyes: and shalt see the reward of the wicked.

9.verse: Because thou, O Lord, art my hope: thou hast made the most High thy refuge.

10.verse: There shall no evil come to thee: nor shall the scourge come near thy dwelling.

11.verse: For he hath given his angels charge over thee; to keep thee in all thy ways.

12.verse: In their hands they shall bear thee up: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

13.verse: Thou shalt walk upon the asp and the basilisk: and thou shalt trample under foot the lion and the dragon.

14.verse: Because he hoped in me I will deliver him: I will protect him because he hath known my name.

15.verse: He shall cry to me, and I will hear him: I am with him in tribulation, I will deliver him, and I will glorify him.

16.verse: I will fill him with length of days; and I will shew him my salvation.

1.verse: A psalm of a canticle on the sabbath day.

2.verse: It is good to give praise to the Lord: and to sing to thy name, O most High.

3.verse: To shew forth thy mercy in the morning, and thy truth in the night:

4.verse: Upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery: with a canticle upon the harp.

5.verse: For thou hast given me, O Lord, a delight in thy doings: and in the works of thy hands I shall rejoice.

6.verse: O Lord, how great are thy works! thy thoughts are exceeding deep.

7.verse: The senseless man shall not know: nor will the fool understand these things.

8.verse: When the wicked shall spring up as grass: and all the workers of iniquity shall appear: That they may perish for ever and ever:

9.verse: But thou, O Lord, art most high for evermore.

10.verse: For behold thy enemies, O Lord, for behold thy enemies shall perish: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

11.verse: But my horn shall be exalted like that of the unicorn: and my old age in plentiful mercy.

12.verse: My eye also hath looked down upon my enemies: and my ear shall hear of the downfall of the malignant that rise up against me.

13.verse: The just shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow up like the cedar of Libanus.

14.verse: They that are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.

15.verse: They shall still increase in a fruitful old age: and shall be well treated,

16.verse: That they may shew, That the Lord our God is righteous, and there is no iniquity in him.

4.verse: For in his hand are all the ends of the earth: and the heights of the mountains are his.

5.verse: For the sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

1.verse: A canticle for David himself, when the house was built after the captivity. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: sing to the Lord, all the earth.

2.verse: Sing ye to the Lord and bless his name: shew forth his salvation from day to day.

3.verse: Declare his glory among the Gentiles: his wonders among all people.

4.verse: For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

5.verse: For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils: but the Lord made the heavens.

6.verse: Praise and beauty are before him: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary.

7.verse: Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour:

8.verse: Bring to the Lord glory unto his name. Bring up sacrifices, and come into his courts:

9.verse: Adore ye the Lord in his holy court. Let all the earth be moved at his presence.

10.verse: Say ye among the Gentiles, the Lord hath reigned. For he hath corrected the world, which shall not be moved: he will judge the people with justice.

11.verse: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad, let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof:

1.verse: For the same David, when his land was restored again to him. The Lord hath reigned, let the earth rejoice: let many islands be glad.

2.verse: Clouds and darkness are round about him: justice and judgment are the establishment of his throne.

3.verse: A fire shall go before him, and shall burn his enemies round about.

4.verse: His lightnings have shone forth to the world: the earth saw and trembled.

5.verse: The mountains melted like wax, at the presence of the Lord: at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens declared his justice: and all people saw his glory.

7.verse: Let them be all confounded that adore graven things, and that glory in their idols. Adore him, all you his angels:

8.verse: Sion heard, and was glad. And the daughters of Juda rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Lord.

9.verse: For thou art the most high Lord over all the earth: thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.

10.verse: You that love the Lord, hate evil: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints, he will deliver them out of the hand of the sinner.

11.verse: Light is risen to the just, and joy to the right of heart.

12.verse: Rejoice, ye just, in the Lord: and give praise to the remembrance of his holiness.

1.verse: A psalm for David himself. Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee, O Lord: I will sing,

2.verse: And I will understand in the unspotted way, when thou shalt come to me. I walked in the innocence of my heart, in the midst of my house.

3.verse: I did not set before my eyes any unjust thing: I hated the workers of iniquities.

4.verse: The perverse heart did not cleave to me: and the malignant, that turned aside from me, I would not know.

5.verse: The man that in private detracted his neighbour, him did I persecute. With him that had a proud eye, and an unsatiable heart, I would not eat.

1.verse: The prayer of the poor man, when he was anxious, and poured out his supplication before the Lord.

2.verse: Hear, O Lord, my prayer: and let my cry come to thee.

3.verse: Turn not away thy face from me: in the day when I am in trouble, incline thy ear to me. In what day soever I shall call upon thee, hear me speedily.

4.verse: For my days are vanished like smoke: and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.

5.verse: I am smitten as grass, and my heart is withered: because I forgot to eat my bread.

6.verse: Through the voice of my groaning, my bone hath cleaved to my flesh.

7.verse: I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness: I am like a night raven in the house.

8.verse: I have watched, and am become as a sparrow all alone on the housetop.

1.verse: For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: and let all that is within me bless his holy name.

2.verse: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and never forget all he hath done for thee.

3.verse: Who forgiveth all thy iniquities: who healeth all thy diseases.

4.verse: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction: who crowneth thee with mercy and compassion.

5.verse: Who satisfieth thy desire with good things: thy youth shall be renewed like the eagle's.

6.verse: The Lord doth mercies, and judgment for all that suffer wrong.

7.verse: He hath made his ways known to Moses: his wills to the children of Israel.

8.verse: The Lord is compassionate and merciful: longsuffering and plenteous in mercy.

9.verse: He will not always be angry: nor will he threaten for ever.

10.verse: He hath not dealt with us according to our sins: nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

11.verse: For according to the height of the heaven above the earth: he hath strengthened his mercy towards them that fear him.

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our iniquities from us.

13.verse: As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him:

14.verse: For he knoweth our frame. He remembereth that we are dust:

15.verse: Man's days are as grass, as the flower of the field so shall he flourish.

16.verse: For the spirit shall pass in him, and he shall not be: and he shall know his place no more.

17.verse: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity and unto eternity upon them that fear him: And his justice unto children's children,

18.verse: To such as keep his covenant, And are mindful of his commandments to do them.

19.verse: The Lord hath prepared his throne in heaven: and his kingdom shall rule over all.

20.verse: Bless the Lord, all ye his angels: you that are mighty in strength, and execute his word, hearkening to the voice of his orders.

21.verse: Bless the Lord, all ye his hosts: you ministers of his that do his will.

22.verse: Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion, O my soul, bless thou the Lord.

1.verse: For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put on praise and beauty:

2.verse: And art clothed with light as with a garment. Who stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion:

3.verse: Who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water. Who makest the clouds thy chariot: who walkest upon the wings of the winds.

4.verse: Who makest thy angels spirits: and thy ministers a burning fire.

5.verse: Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever and ever.

6.verse: The deep like a garment is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand.

7.verse: At thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.

8.verse: The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.

9.verse: Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over; neither shall they return to cover the earth.

10.verse: Thou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.

11.verse: All the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.

12.verse: Over them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices.

13.verse: Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works:

14.verse: Bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men. That thou mayst bring bread out of the earth:

15.verse: And that wine may cheer the heart of man. That he may make the face cheerful with oil: and that bread may strengthen man's heart.

16.verse: The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted:

17.verse: There the sparrows shall make their nests. The highest of them is the house of the heron.

18.verse: The high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins.

19.verse: He hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

20.verse: Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about:

21.verse: The young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God.

22.verse: The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together: and they shall lie down in their dens.

1.verse: Alleluia. Give glory to the Lord, and call upon his name: declare his deeds among the Gentiles.

2.verse: Sing to him, yea sing praises to him: relate all his wondrous works.

3.verse: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

4.verse: Seek ye the Lord, and be strengthened: seek his face evermore.

5.verse: Remember his marvellous works which he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth.

6.verse: O ye seed of Abraham his servant; ye sons of Jacob his chosen.

7.verse: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

8.verse: He hath remembered his covenant for ever: the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

9.verse: Which he made to Abraham; and his oath to Isaac:

10.verse: And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting testament:

11.verse: Saying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan, the lot of your inheritance.

12.verse: When they were but a small number: yea very few, and sojourners therein:

13.verse: And they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.

14.verse: He suffered no man to hurt them: and he reproved kings for their sakes.

15.verse: Touch ye not my anointed: and do no evil to my prophets.

16.verse: And he called a famine upon the land: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread.

17.verse: He sent a man before them: Joseph, who was sold for a slave.

18.verse: They humbled his feet in fetters: the iron pierced his soul,

19.verse: Until his word came. The word of the Lord inflamed him.

20.verse: The king sent, and he released him: the ruler of the people, and he set him at liberty.

21.verse: He made him master of his house, and ruler of all his possession.

22.verse: That he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his ancients wisdom.

23.verse: And Israel went into Egypt: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.

24.verse: And he increased his people exceedingly: and strengthened them over their enemies,

25.verse: He turned their heart to hate his people: and to deal deceitfully with his servants.

26.verse: He sent Moses his servant: Aaron the man whom he had chosen.

27.verse: He gave them power to shew his signs, and his wonders in the land of Cham.

28.verse: He sent darkness, and made it obscure: and grieved not his words.

29.verse: He turned their waters into blood, and destroyed their fish.

30.verse: Their land brought forth frogs, in the inner chambers of their kings.

31.verse: He spoke, and there came divers sorts of flies and sciniphs in all their coasts.

32.verse: He gave them hail for rain, a burning fire in the land.

33.verse: And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig trees: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.

34.verse: He spoke, and the locust came, and the bruchus, of which there was no number.

35.verse: And they devoured all the grass in their land, and consumed all the fruit of their ground.

1.verse: Alleluia. Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2.verse: Who shall declare the powers of the Lord? who shall set forth all his praises?

3.verse: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and do justice at all times.

4.verse: Remember us, O Lord, in the favour of thy people: visit us with thy salvation.

5.verse: That we may see the good of thy chosen, that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance.

6.verse: We have sinned with our fathers: we have acted unjustly, we have wrought iniquity.

7.verse: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt: they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies: And they provoked to wrath going up to the sea, even the Red Sea.

8.verse: And he saved them for his own name's sake: that he might make his power known.

9.verse: And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up: and he led them through the depths, as in a wilderness.

10.verse: And he saved them from the hand of them that hated them: and he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

11.verse: And the water covered them that afflicted them: there was not one of them left.

12.verse: And they believed his words: and they sang his praises.

13.verse: They had quickly done, they forgot his works: and they waited not for his counsels.

14.verse: And they coveted their desire in the desert: and they tempted God in the place without water.

15.verse: And he gave them their request: and sent fulness into their souls.

16.verse: And they provoked Moses in the camp, Aaron the holy one of the Lord.

17.verse: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan: and covered the congregation of Abiron.

18.verse: And a fire was kindled in their congregation: the flame burned the wicked.

19.verse: They made also a calf in Horeb: and they adored the graven thing.

20.verse: And they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass.

21.verse: They forgot God, who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,

22.verse: Wondrous works in the land of Cham: terrible things in the Red Sea.

23.verse: And he said that he would destroy them: had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach: To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

24.verse: And they set at nought the desirable land. They believed not his word,

25.verse: And they murmured in their tents: they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.

26.verse: And he lifted up his hand over them: to overthrow them in the desert;

27.verse: And to cast down their seed among the nations, and to scatter them in the countries.

28.verse: They also were initiated to Beelphegor: and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

29.verse: And they provoked him with their inventions: and destruction was multiplied among them.

30.verse: Then Phinees stood up, and pacified him: and the slaughter ceased.

31.verse: And it was reputed to him unto justice, to generation and generation for evermore.

32.verse: They provoked him also at the waters of contradiction: and Moses was afflicted for their sakes:

33.verse: Because they exasperated his spirit. And he distinguished with his lips.

34.verse: They did not destroy the nations of which the Lord spoke unto them.

35.verse: And they were mingled among the heathens, and learned their works:

36.verse: And served their idols, and it became a stumblingblock to them.

37.verse: And they sacrificed their sons, and their daughters to devils.

38.verse: And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan. And the land was polluted with blood,

39.verse: And was defiled with their works: and they went aside after their own inventions.

40.verse: And the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people: and he abhorred his inheritance.

41.verse: And he delivered them into the hands of the nations: and they that hated them had dominion over them.

42.verse: And their enemies afflicted them: and they were humbled under their hands:

43.verse: Many times did he deliver them. But they provoked him with their counsel: and they were brought low by their iniquities.

44.verse: And he saw when they were in tribulation: and he heard their prayer.

45.verse: And he was mindful of his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

1.verse: Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2.verse: Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: and gathered out of the countries.

3.verse: From the rising and the setting of the sun, from the north and from the sea.

4.verse: They wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty: their soul fainted in them.

6.verse: And they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

7.verse: And he led them into the right way: that they might go to a city of habitation.

8.verse: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

9.verse: For he hath satisfied the empty soul, and hath filled the hungry soul with good things.

10.verse: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death: bound in want and in iron.

11.verse: Because they had exasperated the words of God: and provoked the counsel of the most High:

12.verse: And their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, and their was none to help them.

13.verse: Then they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

14.verse: And he brought them out of darkness, and the shadow of death; and broke their bonds in sunder.

15.verse: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

16.verse: Because he hath broken gates of brass, and burst the iron bars.

17.verse: He took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices.

18.verse: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death.

19.verse: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

20.verse: He sent his word, and healed them: and delivered them from their destructions.

21.verse: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

22.verse: And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: and declare his works with joy.

23.verse: They that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters:

24.verse: These have seen the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

25.verse: He said the word, and there arose a storm of wind: and the waves thereof were lifted up.

26.verse: They mount up to the heavens, and they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils.

27.verse: They were troubled, and reeled like a drunken man; and all their wisdom was swallowed up.

28.verse: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he brought them out of their distresses.

29.verse: And he turned the storm into a breeze: and its waves were still.

30.verse: And they rejoiced because they were still: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for.

31.verse: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

32.verse: And let them exalt him in the church of the people: and praise him in the chair of the ancients.

33.verse: He hath turned rivers into a wilderness: and the sources of water into dry ground:

34.verse: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

35.verse: He hath turned a wilderness into pools of water, and a dry land into water springs.

36.verse: And hath placed there the hungry; and they made a city for their habitation.

37.verse: And they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and they yielded fruit of birth.

38.verse: And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly: and their cattle he suffered not to decrease.

39.verse: Then they were brought to be few: and they were afflicted through the trouble of evils and sorrow.

40.verse: Contempt was poured forth upon their princes: and he caused them to wander where there was no passing, and out of the way.

41.verse: And he helped the poor out of poverty: and made him families like a flock of sheep.

42.verse: The just shall see, and shall rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop their mouth.

43.verse: Who is wise, and will keep these things: and will understand the mercies of the Lord?

1.verse: A canticle of a psalm for David himself.

2.verse: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will sing, and will give praise, with my glory.

3.verse: Arise, my glory; arise, psaltery and harp: I will arise in the morning early.

4.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing unto thee among the populations.

5.verse: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth even unto the clouds.

6.verse: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory over all the earth:

7.verse: That thy beloved may be delivered. Save with thy right hand and hear me.

8.verse: God hath spoken in his holiness. I will rejoice, and I will divide Sichem and I will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

9.verse: Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine and Ephraim the protection of my head. Juda is my king:

10.verse: Moab the pot of my hope. Over Edom I will stretch out my shoe: the aliens are become my friends.

11.verse: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

12.verse: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?

13.verse: O grant us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

14.verse: Through God we shall do mightily: and he will bring our enemies to nothing.

1.verse: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

2.verse: O God, be not thou silent in my praise: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful man is opened against me.

3.verse: They have spoken against me with deceitful tongues; and they have compassed me about with words of hatred; and have fought against me without cause.

4.verse: Instead of making me a return of love, they detracted me: but I gave myself to prayer.

5.verse: And they repaid me evil for good: and hatred for my love.

6.verse: Set thou the sinner over him: and may the devil stand at his right hand.

7.verse: When he is judged, may he go out condemned; and may his prayer be turned to sin.

8.verse: May his days be few: and his bishopric let another take.

9.verse: May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Let his children be carried about vagabonds, and beg; and let them be cast out of their dwellings.

11.verse: May the usurer search all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labours.

12.verse: May there be none to help him: nor none to pity his fatherless offspring.

13.verse: May his posterity be cut off; in one generation may his name be blotted out.

1.verse: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

2.verse: The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

3.verse: With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength: in the brightness of the saints: from the womb before the day star I begot thee.

4.verse: The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech.

5.verse: The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.

6.verse: He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins: he shall crush the heads in the land of the many.

7.verse: He shall drink of the torrent in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

1.verse: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; in the council of the just: and in the congregation.

2.verse: Great are the works of the Lord: sought out according to all his wills.

3.verse: His work is praise and magnificence: and his justice continueth for ever and ever.

4.verse: He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works, being a merciful and gracious Lord:

5.verse: He hath given food to them that fear him. He will be mindful for ever of his covenant:

6.verse: He will shew forth to his people the power of his works.

7.verse: That he may give them the inheritance of the Gentiles: the works of his hands are truth and judgment.

1.verse: Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord: he shall delight exceedingly in his commandments.

2.verse: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed.

3.verse: Glory and wealth shall be in his house: and his justice remaineth for ever and ever.

4.verse: To the righteous a light is risen up in darkness: he is merciful, and compassionate and just.

5.verse: Acceptable is the man that sheweth mercy and lendeth: he shall order his words with judgment:

6.verse: Because he shall not be moved for ever.

7.verse: The just shall be in everlasting remembrance: he shall not hear the evil hearing. His heart is ready to hope in the Lord:

8.verse: His heart is strengthened, he shall not be moved until he look over his enemies.

9.verse: He hath distributed, he hath given to the poor: his justice remaineth for ever and ever: his horn shall be exalted in glory.

10.verse: The wicked shall see, and shall be angry, he shall gnash with his teeth and pine away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.

1.verse: Praise the Lord, ye children: praise ye the name of the Lord.

2.verse: Blessed be the name of the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever.

3.verse: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the name of the Lord is worthy of praise.

4.verse: The Lord is high above all nations; and his glory above the heavens.

5.verse: Who is as the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high:

6.verse: And looketh down on the low things in heaven and in earth?

7.verse: Raising up the needy from the earth, and lifting up the poor out of the dunghill:

8.verse: That he may place him with princes, with the princes of his people.

9.verse: Who maketh a barren woman to dwell in a house, the joyful mother of children.

1.verse: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a barbarous people:

2.verse: Judea made his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

3.verse: The sea saw and fled: Jordan was turned back.

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like the lambs of the flock.

5.verse: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee: and thou, O Jordan, that thou wast turned back?

6.verse: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams, and ye hills, like lambs of the flock?

7.verse: At the presence of the Lord the earth was moved, at the presence of the God of Jacob:

8.verse: Who turned the rock into pools of water, and the stony hill into fountains of waters.

9.verse: Not to us, O Lord, not to us; but to thy name give glory.

1.verse: I have loved, because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer.

2.verse: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me: and in my days I will call upon him.

3.verse: The sorrows of death have encompassed me: and the perils of hell have found me. I met with trouble and sorrow:

4.verse: And I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, deliver my soul.

5.verse: The Lord is merciful and just, and our God sheweth mercy.

6.verse: The Lord is the keeper of little ones: I was little and he delivered me.

7.verse: Turn, O my soul, into thy rest: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee.

8.verse: For he hath delivered my soul from death: my eyes from tears, my feet from falling.

1.verse: Give praise to Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2.verse: Let Israel now say that he is good: that his mercy endureth for ever.

1.verse: ALEPH. Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord.

2.verse: Blessed are they who search his testimonies: that seek him with their whole heart.

3.verse: For they that work iniquity, have not walked in his ways.

4.verse: Thou hast commanded thy commandments to be kept most diligently.

5.verse: O! that my ways may be directed to keep thy justifications.

6.verse: Then shall I not be confounded, when I shall look into all thy commandments.

7.verse: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned the judgments of thy justice.

8.verse: I will keep thy justifications: O! do not thou utterly forsake me.

9.verse: BETH. By what doth a young man correct his way? by observing thy words.

10.verse: With my whole heart have I sought after thee: let me not stray from thy commandments.

11.verse: Thy words have I hidden in my heart, that I may not sin against thee.

12.verse: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy justifications.

13.verse: With my lips I have pronounced all the judgments of thy mouth.

14.verse: I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches.

15.verse: I will meditate on thy commandments: and I will consider thy ways.

16.verse: I will think of thy justifications: I will not forget thy words.

17.verse: GIMEL. Give bountifully to thy servant, enliven me: and I shall keep thy words.

18.verse: Open thou my eyes: and I will consider the wondrous things of thy law.

19.verse: I am a sojourner on the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

20.verse: My soul hath coveted to long for thy justifications, at all times.

21.verse: Thou hast rebuked the proud: they are cursed who decline from thy commandments.

22.verse: Remove from reproach and contempt: because I have sought after thy testimonies.

23.verse: For princes sat, and spoke against me: but thy servant was employed in thy justifications.

24.verse: For thy testimonies are my meditation: and thy justifications my counsel.

25.verse: DALETH. My soul hath cleaved to the pavement: quicken thou me according to thy word.

26.verse: I have declared my ways, and thou hast heard me: teach me thy justifications.

27.verse: Make me to understand the way of thy justifications: and I shall be exercised in thy wondrous works.

28.verse: My soul hath slumbered through heaviness: strengthen thou me in thy words.

29.verse: Remove from me the way of iniquity: and out of thy law have mercy on me.

1.verse: Praise the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

6.verse: Who established the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

7.verse: Who made the great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever.

8.verse: The sun to rule over the day: for his mercy endureth for ever.

9.verse: The moon and the stars to rule the night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

20.verse: And Og king of Basan: for his mercy endureth for ever.

21.verse: And he gave their land for an inheritance: for his mercy endureth for ever.

6.verse: The proud have hidden a net for me. And they have stretched out cords for a snare: they have laid for me a stumblingblock by the wayside.

3.verse: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul: he hath brought down my life to the earth. He hath made me to dwell in darkness as those that have been dead of old:

4.verse: And my spirit is in anguish within me: my heart within me is troubled.

5.verse: I remembered the days of old, I meditated on all thy works: I meditated upon the works of thy hands.

6.verse: I stretched forth my hands to thee: my soul is as earth without water unto thee.

7.verse: Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit hath fainted away. Turn not away thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

1.verse: Blessed be the Lord my God, who teacheth my hands to fight, and my fingers to war.

2.verse: My mercy, and my refuge: my support, and my deliverer: My protector, and I have hoped in him: who subdueth my people under me.

3.verse: Lord, what is man, that thou art made known to him? or the son of man, that thou makest account of him?

4.verse: Man is like to vanity: his days pass away like a shadow.

5.verse: Lord, bow down thy heavens and descend: touch the mountains and they shall smoke.

6.verse: Send forth lightning, and thou shalt scatter them: shoot out thy arrows, and thou shalt trouble them.

7.verse: Put forth thy hand from on high, take me out, and deliver me from many waters: from the hand of strange children:

8.verse: Whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity.

9.verse: To thee, O God, I will sing a new canticle: on the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises to thee.

10.verse: Who givest salvation to kings: who hast redeemed thy servant David from the malicious sword:

11.verse: Deliver me, And rescue me out of the hand of strange children; whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity:

12.verse: Whose sons are as new plants in their youth: Their daughters decked out, adorned round about after the similitude of a temple:

1.verse: I will extol thee, O God my king: and I will bless thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever.

2.verse: Every day I will bless thee: and I will praise thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever.

3.verse: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised: and of his greatness there is no end.

4.verse: Generation and generation shall praise thy works: and they shall declare thy power.

5.verse: They shall speak of the magnificence of the glory of thy holiness: and shall tell thy wondrous works.

6.verse: And they shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and shall declare thy greatness.

7.verse: They shall publish the memory of the abundance of thy sweetness: and shall rejoice in thy justice.

8.verse: The Lord is gracious and merciful: patient and plenteous in mercy.

9.verse: The Lord is sweet to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

10.verse: Let all thy works, O lord, praise thee: and let thy saints bless thee.

11.verse: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom: and shall tell of thy power:

12.verse: To make thy might known to the sons of men: and the glory of the magnificence of thy kingdom.

13.verse: Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages: and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations. The Lord is faithful in all his words: and holy in all his works.

14.verse: The Lord lifteth up all that fall: and setteth up all that are cast down.

15.verse: The eyes of all hope in thee, O Lord: and thou givest them meat in due season.

1.verse: Alleluia, of Aggeus and Zacharias.

2.verse: Praise the Lord, O my soul, in my life I will praise the Lord: I will sing to my God as long as I shall be. Put not your trust in princes:

3.verse: In the children of men, in whom there is no salvation.

4.verse: His spirit shall go forth, and he shall return into his earth: in that day all their thoughts shall perish.

5.verse: Blessed is he who hath the God of Jacob for his helper, whose hope is in the Lord his God:

6.verse: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all things that are in them.

7.verse: Who keepeth truth for ever: who executeth judgment for them that suffer wrong: who giveth food to the hungry. The Lord looseth them that are fettered:

8.verse: The Lord enlighteneth the blind. The Lord lifteth up them that are cast down: the Lord loveth the just.

9.verse: The Lord keepeth the strangers, he will support the fatherless and the widow: and the ways of sinners he will destroy.

10.verse: The Lord shall reign for ever: thy God, O Sion, unto generation and generation.

1.verse: Praise ye the Lord, because psalm is good: to our God be joyful and comely praise.

2.verse: The Lord buildeth up Jerusalem: he will gather together the dispersed of Israel.

3.verse: Who healeth the broken of heart, and bindeth up their bruises.

4.verse: Who telleth the number of the stars: and calleth them all by their names.

5.verse: Great is our Lord, and great is his power: and of his wisdom there is no number.

6.verse: The Lord lifteth up the meek, and bringeth the wicked down even to the ground.

7.verse: Sing ye to the Lord with praise: sing to our God upon the harp.

8.verse: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth. Who maketh grass to grow on the mountains, and herbs for the service of men.

9.verse: Who giveth to beasts their food: and to the young ravens that call upon him.

10.verse: He shall not delight in the strength of the horse: nor take pleasure in the legs of a man.

12.verse: Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem: praise thy God, O Sion.

13.verse: Because he hath strengthened the bolts of thy gates, he hath blessed thy children within thee.

14.verse: Who hath placed peace in thy borders: and filleth thee with the fat of corn.

15.verse: Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth: his word runneth swiftly.

16.verse: Who giveth snow like wool: scattereth mists like ashes.

17.verse: He sendeth his crystal like morsels: who shall stand before the face of his cold?

18.verse: He shall send out his word, and shall melt them: his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run.

19.verse: Who declareth his word to Jacob: his justices and his judgments to Israel.

20.verse: He hath not done in like manner to every nation: and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them. Alleluia.

1.verse: Praise ye the Lord from the heavens: praise ye him in the high places.

2.verse: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

3.verse: Praise ye him, O sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars and light.

4.verse: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens: and let all the waters that are above the heavens

5.verse: Praise the name of the Lord. For he spoke, and they were made: he commanded, and they were created.

6.verse: He hath established them for ever, and for ages of ages: he hath made a decree, and it shall not pass away.

7.verse: Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all ye deeps:

8.verse: Fire, hail, snow, ice, stormy winds which fulfill his word:

9.verse: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars:

10.verse: Beasts and all cattle: serpents and feathered fowls:

11.verse: Kings of the earth and all people: princes and all judges of the earth:

12.verse: Young men and maidens: let the old with the younger, praise the name of the Lord:

13.verse: For his name alone is exalted.

14.verse: The praise of him is above heaven and earth: and he hath exalted the horn of his people. A hymn to all his saints: to the children of Israel, a people approaching to him. Alleluia.

1.verse: Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: let his praise be in the church of the saints.

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: and let the children of Sion be joyful in their king.

3.verse: Let them praise his name in choir: let them sing to him with the timbrel and the psaltery.

4.verse: For the Lord is well pleased with his people: and he will exalt the meek unto salvation.

5.verse: The saints shall rejoice in glory: they shall be joyful in their beds.

6.verse: The high praise of God shall be in their mouth: and two-edged swords in their hands:

7.verse: To execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people:

8.verse: To bind their kings with fetters, and their nobles with manacles of iron.

9.verse: To execute upon them the judgment that is written: this glory is to all his saints. Alleluia.

1.verse: Praise ye the Lord in his holy places: praise ye him in the firmament of his power.

2.verse: Praise ye him for his mighty acts: praise ye him according to the multitude of his greatness.

3.verse: Praise him with sound of trumpet: praise him with psaltery and harp.

4.verse: Praise him with timbrel and choir: praise him with strings and organs.

5.verse: Praise him on high sounding cymbals: praise him on cymbals of joy: let every spirit praise the Lord. Alleluia.
